He has plans to finish building his home--purchasing construction materials such as stones, cement, iron, and blocks to finish his porch, and plaster his walls in order to provide better security and protection for his family. Thanks to the loan from AFODENIC, he will be able to secure a better inheritance and future for his son.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase construction materials to make a porch and plaster the walls

loan.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.en:
Fidelina M. is a single mother of 3 kids living in an extremely poor area in the Dominican Republic. Each day is a battle to feed her children, and she has no chance of saving and getting ahead. She came to Esperanza International in this situation and wanting to change her life. She took out a small loan and started a small business selling clothing in her area. She would travel to a far city to purchase clothes very cheap, then return to sell them in her area. She did well with her small business, and was able to make all her payments and feed her children.

She is now hoping to receive a second and bigger loan, with which she feels like she can create an even bigger business. She hopes to have her own store someday, and to make enough to send all her children to a good school. She said she feels happy for the first time in a long time, and feels like she can be a good provider for her children. She loves them so much and only wants to give them a comfortable life. She now has the means to do that, and she is going to continue to keep growing and generating more money. She has something of her own, and something that gives her a purpose and a drive. She is so excited about this next loan, and excited about this opportunity she is receiving!

loan.use: To purchase clothing

loan.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. M. es trabajador de la Alcaldia de juigalpa con el cargo de promotor social, es de profesion socilogo, soltero, con 50 aos de edad, con 1 hijo el cual esta estudiando en la universidad, su compaera trabaja en un centro de enseanza como auxiliar de contabilidad. Esta solicitando su primer credito porque desea realizar algunas mejoras como son la construccion de una letrina y el porche de la casa, esta es una vivienda pequea, pues es una construccion del INVUR, donde cada usuario tiene que asumir algunos costos, aun no la esta habitando hasta que construya la letrina que es una prioridad; en la actualidad habita en casa de una hijastra, pero espera muy pronto estar en su propia vivienda que han sido los sueos de toda su vida, ya hasta la fecha ha construido 3 y se las ha dejado a las seoras anteriores, piensa que aqui ya sentara cabeza.
texts.en:
Mr. M. works in the mayor's office of Juigalpa as a social promoter and is a sociologist by profession. He is single, 50 years old, and has one son who is a college student. His significant other works in a teaching center as an accounting assistant. He is requesting his first loan because he would like to make some improvements to his home such as building a latrine and a porch. His home is small as it was built through INVUR where each user has to assume some of the costs of construction. He is not yet living in the house as he first needs to finish building the latrine. Currently he is living in his stepdaughter's home but he would like to quickly move to his own home which has been one of his life's dreams. This is actually the third home he has built but he has left the others to his previous wives, but he thinks that with this home, he will finally stay and call it his own.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Construction of a latrine and a porch

loan.name: Totosa Group

texts.en:
Astride M. is 38 years old and a mother of four children. She began her business in 1998 selling doughnuts and spices. Her business prospered until 2006 when a car accidentally drove over her stand and destroyed all of her goods. Astride used to sell on a stand along the main road in her popular area of Eastern Kinshasa. Having no financial resources to restart her business, Astride was out of business for two years.

She resumed the business in February 2008 and joined Totosa, one of Hopes groups last May. With the coming loan, Astride is planning to purchase another sack of wheat flour and to rent a location for her business in a place where she can avoid another car accident, heavy rains and the strong sun. She is also planning to diversify her business by adding an outdoor section to sell beverages.

loan.use: To purchase another sack of wheat flour and rent a location for her business

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Esther Del Socorro

texts.es: La profesora Esther, soltera, de 46 aos de edad, trabaja en el Colegio San Francisco de Asis de Juigalpa como docente, con 25 aos de servicio, esta solicitando su 7mo credito el que utilizara para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, levantar paredes a un espacio techado que tiene para convertirlo en una cocina, ya que esta al aire libre, es una persona sin ayuda, cuenta con su salario solamente, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 20 aos, no estudian ni trabajan porque son discapacitados. Ella ha pagado con responsabilidad sus 6 creditos anteriores conservando hasta el momento la categoria "A". Desea que le continuemos apoyando, pues considera que AFODENIC es una institucion que si esta al servicio de los desposeidos.
texts.en:
Esther is 46 years old, single, and has worked for twenty-five years as a teacher at Saint Francis of Assisi High School in Juigalpa. She is asking for her seventh loan, which she will use to make improvements to her home. She wants to put up walls in an area of her home that already has a roof in order to have an enclosed kitchen, not one open to the elements.

Esther is without additional financial support, and must rely solely on her own salary to make ends meet. She has two disabled children, ages eighteen and twenty, who are unable to work or attend school. She has responsibly repaid all six of her previous loans, and is considered an A-list borrower. She hopes that we will continue to support her as she considers Kiva's partner AFODENIC an institution devoted to the service of the dispossessed.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To put up walls to build a kitchen

loan.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: El Sr. Jos tiene 41 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Enrique Bermdez 380, en la capital de Managua, casado con tres hijos de 9, 13, y 15 aos de edad, que actualmente los tiene estudiando en un colegio del barrio. Sus planes son construir su casa y darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos y esposa. Tiene un pequeo taller de enderezados y pintura con Veinte aos de experiencia, el negocio se inicio con ingreso propio. Sus planes de incrementar su ingreso con nuevas inversiones en herramientas de trabajo para el taller y arreglar el techo del taller. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic sus planes ser hecho realidad, y le podr ofrecer a sus cliente calidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose is 41 years old and lives in the Enrique Bermudez 380 neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He is married with three children who are 9, 13, and 15 years old and are all currently students in the neighborhood school. He would like to build a more comfortable home for his children and wife. He has run a small paint and repair workshop for the past 20 years which he started with his own capital. He would like to increase his income by investing in new tools for the shop and by fixing the shop's roof. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC, he will be able to make his dreams a reality and offer greater quality and safety for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase new tools for his shop in order to offer more services

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Purchase of a large quantity of goods for a small grocery store.

loan.name: Maria Efigenia

texts.es: La profesora M., casa, de 57 aos de edad, trabajadora de la Escuela Elaisa Sandoval de Juigalpa, con 32 aos de servicio, con 2 hijos con preparacion universitaria, acutalmente los 2 estan ejerciendo sacerdocio, ella habita en compaa de su esposa quien trabaja en BANCENTRO de Santo Tomas viajando diariamente. La profesora M. esta solicitando su 2do credito el que utilizara para mejora de su vivienda como es pintura de toda su casa y algunas reparaciones internas si el credito lo permite, en caso de no cumplir con todo lo planificado, priorizara la pintura y con otros creditos har el resto. Ella nunca habia trabajado con creditos, pero ahora se sienta estimulada por la atencion brindada por AFODENIC y continuara trabajando.
texts.en:
M. is a 57 year old married teacher who has worked in the Elaisa Sandoval de Juigalpa school for the past 32 years. She has two college educated children who are both currently priests. She lives with her husband who works in BANCENTRO in Santo Tomas and must travel daily. She is requesting her second loan from AFODENIC in order to improve her home by painting it and repairing the inside as far as the loan will allow. If she can't afford it all with the loan, she will prioritize painting it and will request other loans to finish the rest. She had never used loans before but now feels encouraged by her interactions with AFODENIC and she will continue to work with them.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Painting the house and doing some repairs inside

loan.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es:
Carmen Beatriz es una mujer joven empresaria, que ha visto la oportunidad de hacer negocios sin descuidar el cuidado de su casa y de su pequeo hijo. Su negocio es la venta de suteres para mujer y ropa tpica. Ella compra por mayor la ropa en tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad capital, y los vende a vecinos, amigas y en su iglesia, en la localidad de su casa, que es en la Aldea Cruz Blanca del municipio de San Juan Scatepeques, tiene la estrategia de vender al credito la ropa.. Su esposo la apoya y la respalda, l trabaja como contador en una empresa en la ciudad de Guatemala y viaja todos los das a la ciudad capital. Carmen Beatriz, tiene un hijo de 2 aos de edad, y esta muy contenta por que confa en Dios que podr darle una buena educacin a su pequeo hijo para que l pueda salir adelante en la vida.
Su prstamo lo necesita para invertir en la compra de ropa. En el mes de noviembre 2008, ella y su esposo fueron victimas de la violencia en Guatemala, saliendo del banco los asaltaron y les robaron una fuerte cantidad de dinero, sin embargo ella esta confiada que podr salir adelante en su negocio, con la ayuda de Dios y el respaldo que le da su esposo.
texts.en:
Carmen Beatriz is an enterprising young woman who has found the opportunity to do business without neglecting the care of her home and her small son. She sells women's sweaters and traditional clothing. She buys the clothing wholesale in the capital and then sells them to neighbors, friends and fellow church-goers near her home in the Cruz Blanca village near the city of San Juan Sacatepeques. She sells the clothing on credit. Her husband helps her whenever he can. He works as an accountant in a company in Guatemala City and travels their daily. Carmen Beatriz has a 2 year old son and is very happy because she trusts in God that she will be able to provide her son a good education so he can progress in life. She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of new clothing. In November 2008, she and her husband were victims of the violence that is always present in Guatemala--leaving they bank, they were assaulted and robbed and lost a large amount of money. Nonetheless, she is confident that she will be able to keep growing her business with God's help and her husband's support.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of women's clothing to sell

loan.name: Matondo Group

texts.en:
Souzane began selling second-hand goods in 1987. Over the years, Souzane has acquired solid experience by selling both kitchen utensils and second-hand clothing, even though it was not her business. After she divorced her husband, Suzanne went through a hard time as she did not have any capital to open her business. Souzane then began to sell kitchen utensils and second-hand clothing and made a small profit in doing so.

By the end of every day, Souzane would pay back the goods cost and keep the little bit of profit as agreed with the owner of the items. Through her determination and hard work, she has been able to save enough money to begin her own business and build a loyal customer base that has began to pre-order utensils.

Souzane joined one of Hopes groups named "M.", which means thanks in English, last June. With the coming loan she plans to increase her working capital and be able to buy 1 bale of second-hand clothing and kitchen utensils. This bale will enable her to generate additional profits that will allow her business to grow and change. Souzane is 53 years old and the mother of four children and she also takes care of one other child. She lives with her family in the northern suburban area of Kinshasa.

loan.use: To be able to buy 1 bale of second-hand clothing and some kitchen utensils for re-sale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. ngel tiene 35 aos de edad, habitante del barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 8 y 11 aos de edad. Sus planes son construir su casa. Don ngel posee un negocio de elaboracin de gorras y sombreros desde hace once aos, el negocio lo inicio con capital propio buscando una alternativa para satisfacer sus necesidades. Gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra compra materia prima para elaborar y comercializar su gorras y sombreros es un comercio que se vende, son accesibles en sus costos de ventas, como de gran beneficios para cuidarnos del calor del sol. Esta inversin tendr como objetivo aumentar la produccin y la utilidad en benefici de su familia dndoles una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Angel is 35 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He and his wife have two children who are 8 and 11. He dreams of being able to build his own home. Angel has run a business making caps and hats for the past 11 years; he started the business with his own capital as he looked for alternative ways to provide for his family. Thanks to loans from AFODENIC, he will be able to purchase raw materials to make and sell his caps and hats. It is a very affordable sales business with low costs and that provides important benefits by protecting us from the sun. This investment will be used to increase his production and his profits which will provide a more comfortable living for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of raw materials to make caps and hats

loan.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria Cristina se dedica a la venta de pollo en una colonia localizada en la ciudad de Guatemala, tiene 20 aos en el negocio. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, y tiene 4 hijos. Ha tenido problemas porque hay mucha competencia donde esta su negocio, pero gracias a la forma que ella atiende a sus clientes y la calidad que ofrece ha salido adelante. Todos los das madruga para preparar su venta y poder terminar temprano, cuenta con la ayuda de una empleada que la apoya para la preparacin de su venta...
Con el prestamo ella quiere comprar ms pollos y chompipes (pavos) que es lo que se vende en esta poca. Doa Cristina desea poder mejorar tanto su calidad de vida, como lograr mas facilidades en su negocio, por ejemplo quiere llegar a tener su carro vehiculo para poder llevar su venta.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina has worked selling chicken for the past 20 years in a small residential area in Guatemala City. She has the support of her husband and four children. She has had some challenges because there is a lot of competition where her business is located, but thanks to the good customer service she provides and the quality she offers, she has been able to keep moving forward. Every day she gets up at dawn in order to prepare her chicken for sale and to be able to finish early. She has one employee who helps her prepare the chicken to sell. With this loan, she will buy chickens and turkeys which are sold a lot during this time. Cristina would like to improve her quality of life and grow her business--for example, she would like to eventually purchase a car so that she can more easily carry her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase chickens and turkeys to sell

loan.name: Evelio Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. L. soltero, de 43 aos de edad, Ingeniero Agronomo, trabaja en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como responsable de Desarrollo Rural Integral desde hace 8 aos, tiene 2 hijas estudiando una el 4to ao de secundaria y la otra el 2do ao de universidad, su esposa no trabaja esta como ama de casa al cuido de sus hijas y del hogar. Esta solicitando su 2do credito el que utilizara para poner 15 mts cuadrados de ceramica, pues tiene piso embaldozado y ademas hacer una division de playsen y madera que servira de dormitorio para sus hijas; su primer credito lo cancelo en su fecha establecida con responsabilidad, es una persona con mucho espiritu de superacion, honesto y muy respetado por sus compaeros de trabajo, manifiesta que su casa es grande y que solo a una parte pondra la ceramica, que con futuros creditos terminara la obra que inici con el credito anterior hasta cumplir el sueo de su familia y de l de tener una vivienda digna y confortable.
texts.en:
Sr. L., 43, is an agricultural engineer and works in the township of Juigalpa. He has managed the Comprehensive Rural Development program for 8 years. He has 2 daughters, one in high school and one at college. His wife works at home, caring for the couple's daughters and the house. Sr. L. is applying for a 2nd loan that he will use to lay 15 square-meters of tiled flooring and create a separate space in the house with "playsen" [no translation] and wood that will be used as a bedroom for his daughters. His first loan was paid on time. He's someone with a will to overcome, honest and respected by his co-workers. He points out that his house is large and that only a part of it is tiled. He hopes to finish the work with future loans so that he can fulfill the dream that he and his family have to live in a decent, comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Flooring and other renovations.

loan.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda se dedica a la venta de pollo, tiene su negocio en una colonia de la ciudad Guatemala, tiene 20 aos de tener su negocio, a dems vende chompipes (pavos). Ella tiene seis hijos, y tres estn estudiando actualmente, los otros trabajan y ya no dependen econmicamente de sus padres. Hermelinda cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, ella tiene una empleada que le ayuda a trabajar en la preparacin de los pollos. Todos los das ella se levanta a las cuatro de la maana para poder iniciar su negocio temprano y terminarlo a buena hora. Ella necesita el prstamo para poder comprar pollo, gallinas y chompipes ya que en esta poca de fin de ao se vende ms. Le da gracias a Dios de tener su negocio y desea el prstamo para aumentar sus ventas, y as poder brindarles la ayuda necesaria a sus hijos y apoyarle en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Hermelinda sells poultry for a living. She operates her business in a "colonia" of Guatemala City. She's has had the business for 20 years. She also sells "chompipes" (turkeys). She has six children, three of whom are in school. The others work and no longer depend on their parents. Hermelinda's husband supports her work. She has an employee that helps her prepare the poultry. She gets up everyday at four in the morning in order to start work early and finish at an early hour. She needs the loan to be able to buy chickens, roosters and chompipes because sales are especially brisk this time of year. She thanks God for her business and hopes the loan will increase her sales and provide the income she needs to support her children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy poultry for resale.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Ariel Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Ariel tiene 34 aos de edad, habitante del barrio La Esperanza, casado no tiene hijos pero si anhela un hijo para ensearle, educarlo y darle todo la comodidad que necesite. Don Ariel tiene su pequeo negocio en su casa de Billar desde hace tres aos. Antes trabajaba como maestro de obra y soldador, con ahorros propios inicio el negocio, pero requiere de remodelacin y de nuevos muebles. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra realizar las compras de los inmuebles necesarios para el billar ya que dentro de sus planes es ampliar su local y ofrecerle al cliente una mayor comodidad y seguridad. Asegurndole a su familia una estabilidad econmica y realizar su planes de aumentar la familia con la llegada de un hijo ofrecindole un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ariel, 34, lives in the La Esperanza neighborhood. He's married but has no children. He'd very much like to have a son, a boy to teach and to provide for. Ariel has operated his billiards business for three years. He used to work as a "maestro de obra" [could be foreman or master craftsman, but not clear] and welder. He started the business with his savings, but he still needs funds for renovations and new pool tables. Thanks to Afodenic loans, he's managed to buy some pool tables to start the business. He plans to expand the space now and improve it so that his customers will be more comfortable and secure. His goals are to ensure a stable economic future for his family and build a better future for the son that he'd like to have.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Make improvements to billiards business.

loan.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is Fatmata T., age forty. Fatmata was born in Pailap, a village on the outskirts of Makeni City. She currently resides in Makeni where she is married and running her business. Fatmata and her husband are in the same business together. They have five children, all of whom are going to school. Fatmata owns a grocery shop at the center of town, where she sells items like Peak brand powdered and condensed milk, sardines, batteries, toothpastes, sugar and so on. This will be her very first loan from SMT. She is requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000 to help her strengthen her business.
With this loan, Fatmata will increase her business by buying more goods to add to her current stock. She will use some of it to buy cartons of Peak milks, cartons of sardines, cartons of toothpastes and so on. She will have to buy all of these items in Freetown, a 390 mile round trip from Makeni. In Freetown, a carton of Peak milk costs her Le 130,000, a carton of sardines costs Le 90,000, and a carton of toothpastes costs Le 120,000. She will pay a fare of Le 30,000 to travel with the goods to and from Freetown, and a Le 500 delivery charge for each carton transported.
So far, business is going fine for Fatmata. She believes that the business she is doing is her calling in life, stating my star is on the business. She loves running a business and has been able to get a lot customers.
With the profit that this loan will generate for Fatmata, she will be able to repay her loan on time, reinvest into the business, and take good care of herself and her children.

loan.use: To buy cartons of Peak milks, cartons of sardines, cartons of toothpastes, and so on.

loan.name: Titi

texts.en:
This is Titi S., age forty-five. Titi was born in Tanbiyama, about eleven miles from Makeni City. She currently resides in Makeni, where she is married and running her business. Her husband is a retired police officer and the two have seven children. The eldest is now grown, two are in college, three are in secondary school, and one is in primary school.
Titi sells a number of items both inside and outside her home. She sells items, such as fire wood, rice, sugar, palm oil, mints, biscuits, batteries, oil, flour and a lot more.
This will be her very first loan from SMT. She is requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000 to help her strengthen her business. With this loan, Titi will increase her business by buying more goods to add to her current stock. She will use some of it to buy firewood, three bags of rice, two barters (five gallons make a barter) of red palm oil (the most popular and most abundant cooking oil), and two more barters of white palm oil. She buys some of the goods in Makeni. She buys the palm oil from neighboring villages and the firewood at a location called Mile Fourteen. A barter of red palm oil costs her Le 90,000; a barter of white costs her Le 80,000. A bag of rice costs her Le 108,000.
Titi thanks God for her business, because it is running well for her. With the profit that this loan will generate for her, Titi will enroll herself into an Osusu (rotational savings) group in order to help repay her monthly loan on time. She will also use some for domestic purchases, such as buying bathing and laundry soaps, kerosene for her lamps and food for her family.

loan.use: To buy firewood, three bags of rice, two barters of red palm oil, and two barters of white palm oil.

loan.name: Lazaro Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Lzaro tiene 59 aos de edad, habita en Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, casado con seis hijos de 5, 7, 10, 13,16 y 18 aos de edad y los tiene estudiando. Sus planes para su familia son comprar una casa para cada hija y que tenga su propio hogar con un techo en donde habitar.Don Lzaro tiene su propio negocio un taller de carpintera que lo inicio hace 32 aos para el tiempo de los aos ochenta cuando costaba conseguir la madera y lo inicio con unos prstamos de aquellos aos. Los planes para su negocio es mejorar su taller y ampliarlo un poco ms y comprar materiales para aumentar la produccin. Agracias a los prestamos en Afodenic lograra ampliar su negocio y aumentara sus ingresos, lo cual permitir un mejor futuro para su familia.

loan.use: Comprar productos de materia prima y remodelar el local

loan.name: Samuel A.

texts.en:
This is Samuel A. Kamara, age forty. Samuel was born in Mala Mara, Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone. Samuel is married to a businesswoman and the two have four children together. Three of his children are in primary school and the other is still not of school age. Samuel is a bicycle spare-parts dealer. He has never received a loan from SMT before. He requested a loan of Le 2,000,000 to help him strengthen his business.
With this loan, Samuel will expand his business by buying more goods to add to his current stock. He will use some of it to buy two dozen pedals, three dozen inner tubes and two dozen outer tires. He travels to Freetown to buy these spare parts. Freetown is 390 miles round trip from Makeni. He pays a fare of Le 24,000 for his transportation to and from Freetown. A dozen pedals and inner tubes cost him Le 48,000 in Freetown. A dozen outer tires cost him Le 156,000.
Business is going well for Samuel. The only difficulty he encounters in his business is a drop in sales. Sales can be hard to come by in Sierra Leone, the worlds least developed country. People just dont have the discretionary money to buy Samuels goods. The seasons may also adversely affect Samuels business and his ability to generate sales. Regardless, Samuel loves his business, because its the business alone that he depends on for his daily survival. Having already been able to build one little house, if business continues to go well for him, and he is able to gather enough money, it is Samuels dream to build himself another house.

loan.use: To buy two dozen pedals, three dozen inner tubes, and two dozen outer tires.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Magret S.

texts.en:
This is Magret S. T.. Magret was born in Bafodia, about eighteen miles from Kabala. She is twenty-eight years old. She is married to a teacher. They have four children together. Magret sells cotton and ground-nuts. She has been in this business for six years. Magret is requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000. This will be her very first loan from SMT.
With this loan, Magret will expand her business by buying more goods to add to her current stock. She will use the loan to buy cotton and ground-nuts. She will also use some of the loan for transportation and other expenses relating to her business.
She buys the ground-nuts from a make-shift business center, or luma, called Bamoi, about 160 miles round-trip from Makeni. She buys the cotton from Freetown, Sierra Leones capital city, a 390 mile round trip from Makeni. A bag of ground-nuts costs her Le 180,000 at Bamoi, and a piece of cotton costs her Le 25,000 in Freetown. She estimates that shell be able to get a least five bags of ground-nuts and thirty-six pieces of cotton with the loan.
Although her business is doing well for Magret on the whole, she does, face one great challenge: bad debtors. Some of her customers refuse to pay her on time; some do not repay their debts at all. This instills fear in her as a businesswoman, making it difficult for her to know who to trust and who not to trust.
With this loan she receives from SMT, Magret is expecting a vast improvement in her business and an increase in the amount of profit she makes. An increment in profit means making her life a happier one and generating additional business.

loan.use: Expand on her business by buying more cotton and ground-nuts

loan.name: Tamemgbo Group

texts.en:
This is Abdulai K., Mahawa G., Kadiatu K., Alie K. and Fatmata S.. They called their group "Tamemgbo," a Temne word for lets keep trying. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. They have repaid the previous loans successfully. Their previous loan was for Le 800,000 each. That loan helped them a lot. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan and solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a new loan for Le 1,000,000 each to add to their businesses.
Abdul (right) is the leader of this group. Abdul was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-five years of age, a husband with four children: two in secondary school, one in primary school. The youngest is not of school age yet. Together, he and his wife sell second-hand bed sheets. He has been a businessman for over fifteen years.
With this loan of Le 1,000,000, Abdul will buy about five bales of second-hand bed sheets to add to his business. He travels to Freetown, a distance of 390 miles round trip, to buy the bed sheets. A bale of second-hand bed sheets costs between Le 220,000 and Le 250,000. The fare to and from Freetown is Le 30,000 and a single bale will cost him Le 3,000 to transport back to Makeni.
The only challenge Abdul is facing in his business is that of occasional slow sales. The people of Makeni struggle to generate the discretionary income necessary to purchase fresh bed sheets from Abdul. Also, a challenging rain or dry season can also impede sales. Apart from this, business is going well for him and he loves doing it. His goal now is to be able to buy a plot of land so that he can start building a house.

loan.use: Buy five bales of second-hand bed sheets

loan.name: Marlene

texts.es: La Sr. Marlene tiene 36 aos de edad, habita en La Primavera, casada su esposo es conductor de trasporte pesado, tiene tres lindo hijos de 2, 18 y 20 aos de edad, dos ellos estudian en un colegio de la capital. Los planes para su familia es seguir apoyando su estudios para se preparen y tenga un mejor futuro. Doa Marlene trabaja vendiendo mercadera variadas como: cosmticos, perfumes y otros, desde hace seis aos su mayor dificulta habido en la recuperacin del dinero que fueron al crdito, pero gracias a Dios las persona al final pagaron y sus clientes ha aumentado un poco mas, inicio su negocio con prestamos. Sus planes para su negocio es aumentar sus productos y comprar nuevas mercaderas. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra que su pequeo negocio crezca y sus ingresos aumenten en beneficios de su familia y la aseguracin de un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marlene, 36, lives in La Primavera. Her husband is a truck driver and she has three children, 2, 18 and 20 years old, respectively. Two of her children are studying in Managua. She plans to continue supporting her children's schooling so that they can prepare themselves for a better future. Marlene makes a living selling various products: cosmetics, perfumes, etc. She's operated the business for six years. Her main problem is collecting money for products that she sells on credit. Happily, her customers pay in the end and her client base has increased little by little. Marlene started the business with loans. Her plan for the future is to add new products and increase her sales. Thanks to Afodenic loans, she's succeeded in growing her small business. She's seen the benefits to her family of an extra income and the promise it brings for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy products for resale.

loan.name: Tabaksneh Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed D., Ramatu K., Fatu K. and Isatu S.. They named their group "Tabakseneh," a Temne word for Lets be patient. This will be their eighth loan from SMT. Previous loans have had meaningful effects in the lives of these people. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 1,000,000.00 each. Now they are requesting a loan of Le 1,200,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.
Mohamed D. (right) is the leader of the group. Mohamed is forty-two years of age. He was born in Sanda, about thirty-seven miles from Makeni. He is married to a businesswoman and the two have two children, both of whom are in primary schools. Mohamed sells slippers. He has been in the business for over twenty-two years. He and his wife sell the slippers together.
With this loan, Mohamed will be able to buy at least three and a half cartons of slippers (100 pairs of slippers are in a carton). He has to travel to Freetown to buy the slippers. Freetown is 390 miles round trip from Makeni. In Freetown, a carton will cost him Le 300,000. His travel fare to and from Freetown is Le 24,000 and a Le 2,500 delivery charge is added for each carton.
One of the greatest challenges Mohamed is facing in his business is the high cost of rent for the store he is using. He pays Le 2,600,000 per year. Apart from this, business for him is doing well and fine. The profit he gets from his business makes him a happy man. He will save until the day comes when he will be able to build a house for himeself and his family.

loan.use: To buy at least three and a half cartons of slippers

loan.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel P. C. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani con su esposo, el seor Rafael Chuquimia y sus dos hijos. Isabel vende productos de abarrote directamente a domicilio y su esposo es chofer de transporte publico. Con anteriores crditos realizaron la construccin de una loza sobre la que hicieron los muros de una cocina y un bao. El crdito ser para la construccin en obra fina del bao. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita prstamo y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crdito.
texts.en:
Isabel P. C. lives in her parent's house in the Tembladerani neighborhood [of La Paz] with her husband, Rafael Chuquimia and their two children. Isabel has a grocery business and her husband is a bus driver. With previous loans, they were able to lay a foundation and put up walls for a kitchen and bath. This loan will be used to finish the bathroom. This is the fourth time that Isabel has applied for a loan and the completed socioeconomic analysis favors granting the loan to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Construction.

loan.name: Julia Patricia

texts.es: La Sr. Julia tiene 44 aos de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de managua llamado La Primavera, casada, su esposo trabaja como cadete taxi, tiene dos hijos de 11 y 14 aos de edad, los tiene estudiando en un colegio del barrio. Sus planes para su familia es ofrecerle un mejor futuro. Doa Julia es maestra de primaria tiene dos aos de experiencia, para tener otros ingresos da clase privada a nios en su casa por que es una forma mas de ayudarse econmicamente y tambin a sus alumnos. Dentro de sus planes son cambiar el techo de su casa parcialmente y evitar que el agua filtre en el prximo invierno ya que el zinc esta bien daado. Agracias a los prestamos de. Afodenic lograra que su hogar este seguro y protegido.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old and lives in the La Primavera (Spring) neighborhood of Managua. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She has two children, ages 11 and 14, who study at a secondary school in the neighborhood. For two years, Julia has been a primary school teacher. To earn additional income and to help her students she also does private tutoring in her home.

Julia wants to offer her family a better future, and one of the positive changes she wishes to make is to repair the roof of her home. The zinc covering it is very damaged and she wants to avoid leaks in the coming winter. Thanks to loans from AFODENIC she will be sure that her house is safe and protected.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase construction materials to rebuild her roof

loan.name: Lane Kuru Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Mayeteh K. and Masiray T.. They named their group "Lane Kuru," a Temne word that means Trust in God. They are local entrepreneurs from the town of Makeni. This is the fourth time that theyve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one of the group members received a loan of Le 600,000.00. That loan was a great help to members of this group. The proceeds they earned from the previous loan enabled them to educate, feed, clothe, and provide medical care to their children. Having repaid their previous loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan for Le 800,000 to further strengthen their businesses and improve their living standards.
Isatu (right) is the leader of the group. She is twenty-eight years of age. She was born in Makeni and she is married with three children. Her husband is a teacher in one of the primary schools in Makeni. Two of their children are in secondary school and the other is in primary school. While social standards in Sierra Leone may call for the husband to bear the responsibility of feeding, clothing and educating the wife and kids, this is not feasible in Isatus household. Isatus husband can not afford all this on his measly teaching salary. Isatu must work to support her family. Isatu sells palm-oil (the most popular and most abundant cooking oil in Sierra Leone) and rice in the towns main market.
With this new loan, Isatu will expand on her business by buying about six barters of palm oil (five gallons make a barter). She will also buy a big bag of rice with the loan. A barter of palm oil costs her Le 80,000 in Makeni and a bag of rice cost her Le 108,000.
With the extra profit the she will generate from this loan after providing for her familys needs, Isatu plans to buy a plot of land and dreams of building a house.

loan.use: Buy six barters (30 gallons) of palm-oil

loan.name: Rokom Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu K., Umu S. and Ya Fola K.. They named their group "Rakom Group." They are local entrepreneurs from the town of Makeni. This is the third time theyve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Most recently, each group memeber received a loan of Le 500,000. That loan was a great help to members of this group. It enabled them to expand their businesses, make more profit, and improve their living conditions. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again asking for the same amount of Le 500,000 each. They prefer receiving a loan of Le 500,000, because they can manage this amount well.
Kadiatu (right) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-seven years of age. She was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have two children together. Kadiatu sells rice and salt. She has been in the business for over ten years now.
With this new loan, Kadiatu will expand her business. She will buy more bags of salt and a bag of rice. She will be able to get at least twenty bags of salt. She prefers buying more salt, because salt sells faster than rice. A bag of salt will cost her Le 17,000 and a bag of rice, Le 108,000. She sends her husbands younger brother to buy the goods for her in Freetown.
Kadiatu faces a few challenges in her business. Sometimes sales are a bit difficult, especially when most of the customers travel to makeshift business centers to buy goods, often at slashed prices. Additionally, her husband is not comfortable with her traveling to Freetown by herself to purchase the goods. There is the added expense of sending her brother-in-law instead.
Kadiatus immediate goal is to make a better life for herself. She would like to see her business expand, because this makes her life happy and comfortable.

loan.use: Buy twenty bags of salt and a bag of rice

loan.name: Apolinar

texts.es: A la vivienda del seor Apolinar L. le est haciendo falta poner el vitropiso; pero por el momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para esta mejora. El no pagara mano de obra, porque tambin sabe de construccin y colocara el vitropiso en horas adicionales a su trabajo. El seor Apolinar L. trabaja en una compaa como chofer de trasportes est es el ingreso familiar ya que tiene un hijo de pocos meses de nacido y quiere lo mejor para el. El est solicitando un prstamo para la compra del material y as poder ponerle el vitropiso a su casa.
texts.en:
Apolinar L. has not been able to install floor tiles in his home because he does not have the money necessary to do so. He is requesting a loan to purchase materials to tile the floors. He is skilled in construction, so he will be able to do the installation in his free time and therefore avoid paying labor costs.

Apolinar L. works as a bus driver and is the sole breadwinner in his family. He has a newborn son and wants the best for him.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase materials to tile floors

loan.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Azucenas (White Lilies) Village Bank. She lives with her daughter and her common-law husband, who works as a taxi driver. Maritza sells cheese and fruit in the city of Ayacucho. She buys the fruit in Lima (nine hours from Ayacucho) and brings it back in a rented truck to sell. The cheese is produced in rural areas around Ayacucho, so Maritza travels to rural markets to buy cheese, then brings it to Ayacucho to sell. She has been in this line of work for so long she cant remember when she started.
Maritza is requesting a loan of 1400 soles to buy seasonal fruit, such as mangoes, pineapples and bananas, in Lima.
Maritzas goal for the future is to build her own home and open another business selling clothing (since clothing doesnt spoil).

loan.use: To buy mangoes, pineapples and bananas

loan.name: Adeliz

texts.es: Adeliz tiene 20 aos, vive sola, ya que es soltera. Ella es una joven emprendedora, que a pesar de su juventud piensa muy seriamente en el trabajo y quiere progresar. Se dedica desde hace 4 aos a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, trabaja para una empresa muy conocida de distribucin de productos, siendo muy buena en las ventas logrando buenos ingresos econmicos. Adeliz no encuentra dificultad en su trabajo, ya que gracias a su facilidad de palabra sabe que se abrir un camino prometedor. Se encuentra en su segundo prstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Este dinero ser invertido en la adquisicin de productos por campaa navidea, ella sabe que lograr muy buenas ventas, para lo cual necesita de nuestra ayuda.
texts.en:
Adeliz is 20 years old, single, and lives alone. She is an entrepreneurial young woman, who despite her age thinks very seriously about her career and wants to get ahead. For four years she has sold beauty products from the Avon catalog. Sales are good and she earns a good income. Adeliz has not encountered any problems in her work, and, thanks to her excellent communication skills, has a promising future.

This is her second loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She has been punctual in repaying her first loan. This loan will be used to purchase products for the Christmas season. Adeliz knows that she can sell a lot this season, and for this she needs our help.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase the supply of products available for sale

loan.name: Maximina

texts.en:
Maximina is a member of the Huascahura Village Bank. Maximina is 35 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. Maximina has two stands in the F.Vivanco market, where she sells chickens and cold cuts. Her brother attends the stand. Maximina also works as a secretary on a farm.
She plans to buy turkeys for the Christmas season. Maximina needs a loan of 900 soles to buy turkeys. Maximina dreams of having her own home and hopes that her children will grow up to be working professionals.
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Maximina es socia del Banco Comunal Huascahura. Maximina es conviviente, tiene 35 aos y 2 hijos, Maximina tiene 2 puestos en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. pollos, embutidos, las ventas lo realiza su hermano. Adems Maximina trabaja como secretaria en una granja, Maximina tiene proyectado comprar pavos para L. navidad. Maximina necesita un prstamo D. 900 soles dinero que ser invertido en L. compra D. pavos. Los sueos D. Maximina son tener casa propia, que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loan.use: Buy turkeys

loan.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Azucenas (White Lilies) Village Bank. She is married with two children. Carmen sells clothing at a market stand in the city of Ayacucho; the stand belongs to her cousin. She travels by bus to the city of Lima (nine hours away) to buy the clothing, then brings it back to Ayacucho to sell. She has been selling clothing for ten years. Before that, she sold dry goods, such as rice, flour and sugar, from a mobile cart, but for health reasons she decided to sell clothing instead, since the goods weren't quite as heavy.
Carmen is requesting a loan of 2,600 soles to buy more clothing in Lima to stock up for the Christmas season. This is her third loan cycle with FINCA. Her goal for the future is to buy her market stand from her cousin.

loan.use: Buy clothing to sell for the Christmas season

loan.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a member of the Sumacc Huayna (Beautiful Flower in Quechua) Village Bank. She is the single mother of one young son, and lives with her adoptive family. Her adoptive grandmother, Nicolaza, works with the same Village Bank and is also a Kiva client.
Johana and her family sell handicrafts from their stand in the Ex-Penal Market, an old jail near the center of Ayacucho that has been converted into an artisans market. Each artisan has their own small space in what used to be a jail cell. They sell silver jewelry, embroidery, ceramics and alabaster sculptures from their stand.
Johana needs a loan of 1,000 soles. She plans to use the money to travel to Lima to have some medical tests done on her son, who is having some stomach problems. Johanas goals for the future are to start a larger business, employ more embroiderers, and to start exporting her crafts.

loan.use: Travel to Lima, pay for medical testing

loan.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 48 aos, es conviviente, tiene 6 hijos menores que estn en estudios primarios. Hace 10 aos se dedicaba a la compra y venta de quesos juntamente con su esposa, pero ahora el negocio se lo deleg a su compaera porque ha encontrado un trabajo como albail en la construccin de una piscina temperada y ah el viene prestando sus servicios, al trmino de la obra considera que volver a su misma rutina del negocio. Nos comenta que la venta de quesos en muy rentable, porque con cada uno gana de 2 a 3 soles, pero tambin dice que es bueno contar con un trabajo donde se tenga un sueldo fijo, y si por l fuera, le gustara trabajar todo un tiempo como albail y su esposa dedicarse al venta de los quesos, sera doble ingreso a su economa familiar. Es su 5to prstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado ser posible incrementar su capital para la compra de quesos y mantequillas de la ciudad de Junn y transportarlos a la capital para su comercializacin.
texts.en:
Rolando is 48 years old, married and has six young children that are in primary school. For 10 years he has been dedicated to buying and selling cheeses together with his wife, but now he has delegated the business to his partner because he has found a job as a bricklayer in the construction of a heated pool and he provides his services there. At the end of the job he plans to return to his routine business. He told us that selling cheese is very profitable because each one earns 2 or 3 soles (US $0.60- $1.00 ) but he also says it is good to have a job with a fixed salary and if he could he would like to work all the time as a bricklayer and his wife could dedicate herself to selling cheese, which would double the household income. This is his 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the requested money he will increase his capital to purchase cheeses and butter from the city of Junn and transport them to the capital to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase cheese and butter to sell

loan.name: Queta

texts.es: Queta tiene 51 aos de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos, de los cuales vive solo con 2 de ellos, la mayor est estudiando en una universidad en la ciudad de Lima. Cuando Queta se cas su esposo trabajaba para una empresa, pero hace 12 aos atrs lo liquidaron, entonces decidieron comprar una casa en la provincia de Tarma y luego poner un restaurante, y ella es la encargada de poner la sazn, va muy bien, le es muy rentable, hace 6 aos decidi implementar en la otra parte de su casa una fuente de soda, en esto demor en coger clientela, pero igual, esta viendo que ya le es rentable. En ciertas oportunidades, sobre todo cuando se trata de fiestas patrias o en la semana santa le va sper bien. Las dificultades que tiene es cuando le falta dinero para enviarle a su hija que est estudiando. Es su 5to prstamo de Microfinanzas Prisma. Este dinero lo invertir en su fuente de soda y considera que ser suficiente para acrecentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Queta is 51 years old, married and has three children of which two still live with her. Her oldest daughter is studying at a university in Lima. When Queta got married her husband worked for a company, 12 years ago he lost his job at which point they decided to buy a house in the province of Tama and open a restaurant there. She is in charge of establishing the particular flavor of the place, the business is doing well and is very profitable. Six years ago, they decided to open a soda shop in another section of the house. This took a while to catch on with the customers but it is becoming profitable. On certain occasions, especially on federal holidays or during holy week they do especially well. Her problems arise when she does not have enough money to send to her daughter who is in school. This is the fifth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. This money will be invested in the soda fountain business and she thinks it will be enough to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in the soda fountain business

loan.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 31 aos de edad, es conviviente, tiene un solo hijo, y vive en la casa de su suegra. Desde los 20 aos se dedica al trabajo en construccin a base de cemento, y hace como 5 aos se perfeccion en enchapados, y tambin llev cursos adicionales de pintado, por ello puede realizar los trabajos ms exigentes de sus clientes, con acabados impecables. Le agrada su labor, trabaja con mucho arte y armona para que el cliente quede satisfecho, y sobre todo trata de ser muy cumplido, cuando recin empez era difcil, porque las personas no lo conocan, pero ahora reconocen su buen trabajo y lo recomiendan. Es su 5to prstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y paga en las fechas indicadas sus cuotas. Solicita este dinero para comprar una herramienta cortadora de maylica, que le ayude a realizar los enchapadas en las lpidas para difuntos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 31 years old, has a partner and an only son, and lives in his mother-in-law's house. Since he was 20 years old he has worked in cement construction. About 5 years ago he became real good with veneers and also took additional classes in painted coatings, he now can perform the most demanding jobs for his customers with impeccable finish. He loves his work and performs it with art and harmony so that his customers are satisfied. Above all else he is very courteous. When he fist started it was difficult, because people did not know him, now they know his good work and recommend him. This is his 5th loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and he makes his payments on a timely basis. He is requesting this loan to purchase a cutting tool for tile, which will help him make veneers for tomb stones.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of tools for his trade.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 27 aos, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, est viviendo en la casa de sus padres. Hace 5 aos trabajaba vendiendo productos de belleza, pero decidi incrementar su economa e invertir en la panadera de su padre, y hace un ao se est dedicando a este negocio porque es muy rentable vender pasteles, tortas, queques y dems bocaditos, lo que no le gusta es tener que estar ofreciendo por las calles de manera ambulante, pero como tiene tres hijos a quienes mantener se esfuerza en hacerlo. Ella suea con tener su pastelera estable y ya no tener que ir ofreciendo por las calles. Es su 5to prstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y siempre paga en la fecha indicada sus cuotas. El dinero ser invertido en la compra de harina para la panadera, de ese modo pueda ir acumulando ms capital para su futura pastelera.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old, a single mother with three children and lives with her parents. She has been selling beauty products for the last five years, but decided to increase her income and invest in her father's bakery. For the last years she has dedicated her time to this business because it is very profitable, selling pastries, tortes, cakes and snacks. She does not like having to sell on the streets as a peddler, but since she has three children to support she makes the effort to do it. She dreams of having her stable bakery and not needing to sell in the streets. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she always makes her payments on the indicated dates. She will use the money to purchase flour for the bakery, this way she can continue to accumulate income for her future bake shop.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of flour for her bakery.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 49 aos, es casada, tuvo 4 hijos, D. los cuales est viviendo solo con dos D. ellos. DesD. muy joven le ha gustado L. costura, es muy eficiente en L. reparacin D. prendas, despus D. visitar su taller D. costura L. ropa sale casi nueva; a elL. le gusta mucho su trabajo y no siente cansancio. Hace como 6 aos tambin venD. golosinas, porque solo L. costura no le es tan rentable, ya que tiene que ganar para poder pagar el alquiler del local, por ahora no tiene dificultad alguna y sobre todo tiene muchos clientes seguros y conocidos. Es su 5to prstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado ha decidido comprar materiales D. costura, tanto hilos, como cierres y botones.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old, married and had 4 children of whom two are living with her. She has liked to sew since she was very young, and is very good in the alteration of clothing. After being in her sewing shop, the clothes come out looking like new. She likes her work and does not tire. Since about 6 years ago she also sells sweets, because her sewing is not so profitable by itself and she has to earn income to pay the rent of the shop. She currently does not have a problem covering her expenses especially since she has many known and returning customers. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is on time with her payments. With the requested funds she has decided to purchase sewing materials, such as threads, zippers and buttons.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of sewing materials.

loan.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 39 aos, es separada, vive en casa de su madre con sus tres hijos menores. Desde muy nia apoy en el restaurante de su madre, cuando form su familia se dedic al cuidado de su hijos, pero desde el momento de su separacin volvi a la casa de su madre y nuevamente a trabajar en el preparado de los men para los clientes del restaurante que su madre administra. Le agrada la cocina y el comercio, pero su esposo era muy machista, y no pudo realizarse en el mundo del negocio. Ahora tiene la ilusin de tener un negocio propio y trabajar con esfuerzo para su futuro y el de sus hijos. Es su 5to prstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. El dinero solicitado le servir para emprender con su propio restaurante, espera conseguir clientela muy rpido, y est muy agradecida por todo este tiempo con MFP, cuyos crditos le sirvieron para ahorrar y ahora estar lista para iniciar su independencia.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 39 years old, separated and lives in her mother's house with her three small children. She has helped in her mother's restaurant since she was a girl, when she had her family she dedicated her time to taking care of her children. Since her separation, she has returned to her mother's house and again works in the preparation of the food for the customers of the restaurant that her mother runs. She likes cooking and the business, but her husband was very chauvinistic and she was not able to enter the business world. She now has a dream of having her own business and has put all her efforts toward a future for herself and her children. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The funds requested will help her get her own restaurant and she expects to get customers very quickly. She is very grateful for all her time with MFP, whose loans have made her able to save and now be ready to embark on her independence.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Start her own restaurant.

loan.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita tiene 38 aos de edad, es separada, ahora vive en compaa de sus dos hijos y su madre que est ya muy anciana. Sus padre fueron comerciantes de verduras en el mercado de la ciudad, su padre se dedicaba a vender papa en el mercado de mayoristas. Cuando se cas slo se ocupaba de su hogar, pero la separacin le cambi el rostro a su vida, empez a vender verduras en el mercado, y hasta el momento su negocio le es muy rentable, solo que tiene que madrugar a las 3.00am para comprar los productos del mercado mayorista, desayunar y luego armar su carpa y vender sus productos, la nica dificultad que tiene es que no puede cargar mucho peso porque est enferma de la columna. Es su 5to prstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y hasta ahora no tiene dificultad de pagos. El dinero se invertir en la compra de verduras y de ese modo pueda incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jovita is 38 years old, separated, and now lives with her two children and elderly mother. Her parents were vegetable merchants at the city market, her father selling potatoes at the wholesalers market. When she married, she concentrated on caring for the home but after separating from her spouse she had to change her role in life. She started selling vegetables at the market and, to this day, her business is very profitable. However, she must rise at 3:00 a.m. to buy from the wholesalers, have breakfast, and then stock her stand to start selling her products. Her only difficulty is that she cant carry heavy loads because of back problems. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has not had any issues with repayments so far. The funds will be invested into the purchase of vegetables and, in this manner, she will be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To increase the quantity of vegetables that she sells.

loan.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela tiene 65 aos D. edad, es casada, tuvo 3 hijos, D. los cuales ahora viven con ella dos D. ellos. DesD. muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio D. varios artculos, ahora hace bollitos son unos postres que lleva a otra ciudad y los venD. a un precio que le permite tener buenas ganancias y al alcance del bolsillo del cliente. Tambin venD. tamales (plato tpico del pas) desD. hace 20 aos, con ellos ha ganado mucha clientela que le permite ganar casi la mitad D. su inversin, este negocio lo desarrolla solo tres das a la semana, los otros das se va llevando sus bollitos a otra ciudad. La nica dificultad que siente que veces las fuerzas ya no le responden como ella quisiera, y es por su edad. Es su 5to prstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y no tiene dificultades D. pago. El prstamo lo invertir en la compra D. harina para la preparacin D. los bollitos y con el resto comprar una mquina D. molino que funcione con electricidad.
texts.en:
Graciela is 65 years old, married, and had three children of whom two now live with her. Since she was a youngster, she has dedicated herself to the sale of various articles. She now makes bollitos, which are desserts that she takes to another city to sell at a price that allows her to have a good income. She also sells tamales (a traditional dish of that country), which she has done for twenty years. With these activities, she has gained a great deal of customers allowing her to earn nearly half of her investment. She tends to her business three days per week, using the other days to transport her bollitos to the other city. The only difficulty she feels at times is that she doesnt have as much energy any more, which is due to her age. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has had no problems with her repayments. The loan would be invested into the purchase of flour for making her bollitos, and the remaining funds for the purchase of an electric grinder/mill.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase flour to make her bollitos (a local dessert).

loan.name: Nohem

texts.es: La seorita Noem A. en casa de una amiga, y trabaja en un saln de belleza. La vivienda necesita protecciones de metal en puertas y ventanas porque ellas trabajan todo el da y temen ser victimas de un robo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por ello solicita un prstamo para darle seguridad a la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Noem A. lives at a friends house and works in a beauty salon. The home needs additional security, such as metal bars on the doors and windows, because she works all day and fears they will be victims of a robbery. She is a very hard-working person and for this reason requests this loan to provide added security to the house where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To install protective metal bars on the doors and windows of the house she lives in.

loan.name: Miriam Nalleli

texts.es: La seorita Miriam Nalleli H., tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su mam, y ambas viven en una casa de renta. El costo de la renta se ha incrementado y cada vez ms difcil para ella cubrir ese gasto, por tal motivo esta tramitando un crdito para obtener su propia casa mediante Infonavit (Crdito Gubernamental). Sin embargo el valor de la vivienda es mayor que el crdito que puede recibir, y a que su sueldo es bajo. Por ello est solicitando un prstamo para completar el valor de la vivienda y obtener as la casa que necesitan ella y su mam.
texts.en:
Miriam Nalleli H. is responsible for caring for her mother, and they both live in a rented house. Their rent has gone up and, each time, it becomes more and more difficult to cover this expense. For this reason, she has applied for a loan in order to buy her own house via Infonavit (Government Credit). Despite this, the cost of the home is more than the credit she is able to access due to her low level of income. This is the reason she is requesting this loan, so she can meet the amount required to buy the house that she and her mother need.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Down payment for an Infonavit (Government Credit) house.

loan.name: Patron San Salvador De Pucyura Group

texts.es: El banco comunal patron san salvador de Pucyura, esta conformada por 13 socias, 10 mujeres y 03 varones. El distrito de Pucyura se encuenta en la provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. las socias se didican al comercio de productos agricolas, papa, maiz, cereales y comercio de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos), el comercio minorista en los principales mercados funciona de la siguiente manera, las socias compran productos y lo revenden en las principales ferias de la provincia de Anta y en la feria sabatina de productos de los dias sabados en la ciudad del cusco,obteniendo de esta manera pequeos margenes de comercializacion. El banco comunal se encuentra en el V-ciclo, fue fundado en nov del ao 2002, las socias valoran el credito porque incrementa su capital de trabajo y las socias pueden comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderia y de esta manera obtener mejores margenes de ganancia. conjuntamente con el credito el ahorro es de mucha importancia para las socias.
texts.en:
The cooperative bank Patron San Salvador de Pucyura is comprised of thirteen members, ten women and three men. The Pucyura district is located in the Anta province of the Cusco region, about 30 minutes outside the city of Cusco itself. The members dedicate themselves to the sale of various agricultural products such as potato, corn, grains, as well as of small animals (guinea pigs, chickens, pigs). Retail sales in the principal markets of the area works in the following manner: the members purchase their products and resell them in the major markets of the Anca province, as well as at the market that takes place each Saturday in the city of Cusco. In this manner, they obtain a small measure of commerce. The cooperative bank is in its fifth year, having been founded in November of 2002. The members value the credit because it allows them to access working capital and they can purchase greater quantities of merchandise to increase their incomes. Together with the credit, saving is very important to the members.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase agricultural products to sell.

loan.name: Jess Manuel

texts.es: El seor Jess Manuel L. es padre de familia, tiene dos hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian. Con dos crditos anteriores de FVP ha construido dos cuartos pero le falta colocarles el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea ms segura y duradera. El est solicitando un prstamo para esa construccin y planea pagar con sus ingresos de chofer de camin de carga. Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Jess Manuel L. is the father of two teenage children who are currently in school. With previous loans from FVP, he has built two rooms which still need a roof. He has as a construction project the building of a concrete slab so the home will be more sturdy and durable. He is requesting a loan for this construction, and he plans to make his payments using his income from driving a truck. His wish is for his children to have their own room and a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a concrete slab in two rooms.

loan.name: Mara Guadalupe

texts.es: La Sra. C. es una mujer con gran decisin, tiene la gran responsabilidad de ser la jefe de familia, al igual trabaja en oficinas del gobierno para solventar la educacin de sus pequeos. Ella tiene su casita y con prstamos anteriores ha ido realizando varios cambios, sin embargo an le falta gran cantidad de mejoras. En esta ocasin, desea levantar las bardas en la parte frontal de la vivienda, este proyecto es fundamental para salvaguardar la integridad de su familia. Estar muy agradecida con todos los que deseen apoyarla, en cuanto se logren los planes mencionados se les mantendr informados.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. is a very decisive woman, with great responsibility as the head of household. In addition, she works in the offices of the government in order to pay for her childrens educations. She has a small house and, with previous loans, has completed various changes. Regardless, she still needs to make a number of improvements. On this occasion, she would like to heighten the walls on the front part of the home. This project is an integral part of safeguarding the integrity of her family. She would be very grateful to all those who would choose to support her and, as she completes the aforementioned plans, she will keep everyone informed on the progress.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For materials and labor for some walls.

loan.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El seor Jos Manuel O. trabaja como conductor de un ferrocarril de carga con lo que genera ingresos para su familia. Su pap que ya es una persona de edad avanzada sufre una enfermedad que requiere de un tratamiento costoso. El desea ayudarlo, pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para est necesidad familiar. Por tal motivo solicita un prstamo para pagar el tratamiento y las medicinas que su pap necesita para estar mejor. Planea pagar este prstamo con los ingresos de su trabajo como empleado de ferrocarriles.
texts.en:
Jos Manuel O. works as a freight train conductor, which is how he generates income for his family. His father, now of advanced age, suffers from an infirmity that requires costly treatments. He wishes to help him, but does not currently have the necessary funds to cover the familys needs. For this reason, he requests a loan to pay for treatments and medicines to help make his father better. He plans to repay this loan with his salary as a train conductor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To pay for medical expenses.

loan.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is married to Reynaldo N., who is a farmer and a public servant in their village. She is a member of Green Ladies' Association, a group that advocates for the clean and green program. Pacita sees to it that she can help her fellow villagers as best she can when crises arises.They live in a village that is a relatively agricultural area where corn and rice grow in the mountainside of the village.
With the help of her husband, Pacita sells banana cue on sticks, banana sweets, and sometimes, when she has extra time, she processes banana chips and sells them in front of the elementary school in their village. In order to increase her profits, she needs additional products to sell to her customers. She can only do that if she can borrow Php5,000.
Moreover, she thinks that selling fish, after she has sold all of her banana products, can also bring her income. The increased capital will definitely earn her more profits and, therefore, more savings for her family's future. She expects that her weekly net income will be as high as Php1,500, if her plans would come true.

loan.use: Additional working capital

loan.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios, 47 years old, is married to Maximo Sr., a driver. They are blessed with five children: Jovilyn, Maximo Jr., Samuel, Ruben, and Herson. Two of their children already have their own families, but still continue to live with them. Their unmarried children stopped studying due to financial problems. They live in the urban area of Osmenia Ilagan, Isabela. Remedios simply relates that they help each other in order to survive lifes difficulties.
Remedios opened a canteen in the village where she displays and sells snack and viands. She earns an average weekly net income of PHP2,000 from her canteen. She hopes to borrow P10,000, which she will use to expand her business.
Remedios said that sacrifice is the only key to the growth of her business. She is thankful that there are people and institutions who are willing to lend money to poor people like her, who want to uplift themselves. She has a good repayment record and is maintaining this, so that she will always be trusted by the lenders.

loan.use: Additional capital

loan.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn, married with five children, lives in Barangay Lullutan. She has a community-based variety store which generates an average daily net income of Php150. Most of her customers are farmers and fishermen, since the major sources of livelihood in this area are farming and fishing.
Twice a week, she goes to the town of Ilagan to purchase needed commodities. To cross Lullutan River, she must ride a ferryboat. Bringing back the purchased items is very risky, costly, and time consuming. That is why I am thinking of going to the market just once a week, Revelyn added.
She believes that increasing her products will give her more profit and savings.She will be able to provide what the people in her community need and, therefore, they do not need to go to the town. She will need additional money amounting to Php7,000 to realize her plan. She is so hopeful that, with the increased income and savings, her familys life will be a lot better, and it will enable her to send her children to good school.

loan.use: Additional capital

loan.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Roselinda, commonly known as Rosing, is married to Alfred. They live in their simple house in Barangay Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela since their three children have their own families already.

Roselinda owns 2 "bangkas" (manually operated small boats to transport people) but one is not functioning. Since their community is located beside a river, people need to ride motorized small boats, which made Roselindas business in-demand to their community. It would be of great help if could have the needed capital to repair the damaged boat. When repaired, the boat is expected to double their daily income. She requested the amount of P7,000.

Roselinda is being helped by her husband who usually wakes up as early as 6 o clock in the morning to catch the daily commuters who are going to the town of Ilagan, the capital of Isabela province. It shows that they have a strong partnership, which is necessary to sustain their business, the only source of their daily income. Rosing would also like to save a part of their income for their future.

loan.use: Repair damaged boat

loan.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 33 years old, is a mother of three children (Alvin, 15; Esterika, 8; John Paul, 5) and the wife of Arnel, a tricycle operator. They are living in the urban area of Barangay Compania Tumauini, Isabela.

In order to support their familys needs, Rowena engaged in "bangus" (milkfish) and barbecue selling. She has been in this business since 1998 and it is really her dream to make her business grow. However, her weekly gross income of Php2,500 is just enough to maintain her business and provide for the family's needs. Rowena applied for a loan of Php8,000 to buy a large volume of milkfish and maintain her barbecue business. She believes that if she could properly use the money in her business, her dreams of a successful business and the realization of her children's college education will all come true because she will be able to earn more profit and save more.

Rowena said that she has to sacrifice and be patient in order to maintain her business so that they will have a progressive life someday. Through the success of her business, Rowena is able to pay her weekly amortizations and monthly bills. The financial assistance to be given to us is of great help to those people in dire need like me," she added.

loan.use: Buy fish in bulk

loan.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Farming is the major source of income for the local residents of Barangay Lullutan, where Mrs. Victorina T. and her family are living. Lullutan is situated in the other side of the Cagayan River and can only be reached through riding in a small ferry boat or bangka, as local people call it. She engages in a small community store to support the needs of her family. Victorina is married and blessed with four children.

Aside from having a store, her husband owned and operated a small bangka to transfer passengers on the other side. But because of the prevailing crisis, her capital in the store has been used for their boat. Thus, Victorina is requesting additional fund amounting to Ps. 6,000 to further pursue her selling business to support their daily living and school allowances for her children.

loan.use: Additional working capital

loan.name: R.c. Boys School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the RC Boys School in Magburaka. R.C Boys is a primary school. It was founded in 1955 by the Catholic missionaries. Today, it has a total of 250 pupils with a staff of twelve teachers and administrators. This school is proud that they almost always earn a 98-100% pass rate on the National Primary School Exams (NPSE).
RC Boys had never got a loan from SMT before. They heard of SMT from colleagues in other schools who have benefited greatly from SMTs services. They decided to form a group and send in an application to SMT requesting a loan after hearing these other success stories. With the loan, some of the staff members will start a small business and those who are already run small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.
Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus making teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivator is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classroom have to find other ways of making ends meet. The vast majority of them engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (although this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest it in something productive. Many want to go to school but could not afford the cost. Some will want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salary is not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs. And with their monthly salaries, they can repay easily via a payroll deduction type of system.
