texts.en: Gunduz lives in Khachmaz town. He was born in 1957. He is a widow. He has cooked kabab for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy meat for cooking the tasty kabab.

loan.use: to buy meat for cooking the tasty kabab

loan.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy S., 30, is married and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. This couple together has three children and all of them are students. She and her husband, Uch Lim Huon, 34, have a business purchasing banana and banana blossoms from growers and selling them to the market and are able to make $5 of profit a day. On an average month, she spends $60 on food, $5 on utilities, $30 on childrens education and $15 on transportation.
She would like to take out a loan of $1000 to rent a banana farm. She believes this will increase the family income.

loan.use: To rent a banana farm.

loan.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng R., 28, is married and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She works with her husband recharging all kinds of batteries in the village to earn a living and is able to make $4 of profit a day. Most of the people in the village depend on batteries to power their lighting, TVs and radios.
Seng R. is asking a loan of $500 to purchase a new generator to help recharge batteries. (Husband is pictured)

loan.use: To purchase a new generator.

loan.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea T., 55, is married and lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 each day and are supported by two children working in the garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chea T. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase a water pump. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family. (Husband is pictured)

loan.use: To purchase a water pump.

loan.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi, married, has 3 children. He was born in 1959. 10 years ago he started this business. He lives in Khachmaz town. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy fruits from the villages for sale in town.

loan.use: To buy fruits from the villages for sale in town

loan.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam L. H., 45, is married and resides with five of her children in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Three of their children are students and one is garment worker. She is a farmer and tailor. On average, she makes $1 a day. Her husband Vorn Von, 45, is a horse-cart driver who normally transport wood and is able to make $6 of profit a day.
Sam L. H. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase a good horse for her husband. This will allow her husband to transport more goods.

loan.use: To purchase a good horse.

loan.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor K., 31, lives with her husband and child in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has been selling soup and porridge to earn a living and is able to make $2 of profit a day. Her husband, 43, is a construction worker building house and carpenter and makes $7 a day. Sor K. would like to take out a loan of $800 to purchase a sawing machine and other tools for her husband.

loan.use: To purchase a sawing machine and other construction tools.

loan.name: Nun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Nun is the leader of a five-member group. The members live in Ta Lart village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Mrs. P. Nun has a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn money to support the family. In order to earn more income from this plantation, Mrs. P. Nun is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate more rice. She hopes to increase her income to provide better conditions for the family.

Her husband, Mr. Dith CH., helps her on the plantation. Mrs. P. Nun is 50 years old and has four children; one is a guard, and the other three are employed in a garment factory.

loan.use: Buy a piece of land to cultivate more rice and increase income

loan.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Six people living in the Chrolong village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia, make up the group loan. They will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Lim V. is the group leader. She owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sanh Da, is a fisherman. He does not have enough fishing tools. So Mrs. Lim V. is requesting a loan to buy those tools for her husband's business. Mrs. Lim V. is 24 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

loan.use: Buy fishing tools for the fishing business

loan.name: Hou

texts.en:
Hou S., 39 resides with her six children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She makes and sells tofu to the market and is able to make $3 of profit a day. Her husband, Kong Bun Thoeun, 40, has a business raising fish and owns a grinding mill. On average, he makes $8 a day. Five of their children are students and one is too young to attend the school. Every month, they spend $100 on food, $30 on utilities and $50 on childrens education.
Hou S. would like to take out a loan of $1200 to purchase rice and beans for her husband. Her husband will use the mill to take off husks from the rice and beans and then resell the crops for profit.

loan.use: To purchase rice and beans to grind

loan.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara was born in 1985. She lives in Khachmaz region and is single. She has been in the cattle breeding business for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy 2 calves to improve her cattle breeding business.

loan.use: to buy 2 calves

loan.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay O., 56, is a widow and has three children. Two of her children are employed by a local casino as dealers and another one is unemployed. She owns a grocery stand at home, selling food provisions and food products to the people in her community. In 2003, she and her husband made a business selling food products to different areas by using a horse-cart as transportation. Unfortunately, in 2005 her husband died. She decided to make a business at home rather than making business that required traveling.
Lay Ory has applied for a loan to purchase a motor-bike for her unemployed son so that he can generate more income for his household by operating a motor-taxi business.

loan.use: To buy a motor-bike to operate a motor-taxi business

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loan.name: Mrs. Bourey Khem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bourey K. has been selected by the members of the group as the village bank president. All eleven members live in the Da village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. Bourey K. has a 1.8-hectare plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Heng Hon, is a fisherman, and his boat needs to be repaired. In order to restart his fishing business, Mrs. Bourey K. is requesting a loan to fix her husbands boat. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy more fishing tools. She hopes that her husband can catch more fish to support the family. Mrs. Bourey K. is 22 years old and the mother of a one-year-old child.

(Mrs. Mao B. is not requesting a loan, but her husband is, so he is in the picture.)

loan.use: Repair the fishing boat and buy more fishing tools

loan.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben S., 26, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. This couple has one child who does not attend school yet. She works with her husband selling roast beef and pork and other foodstuffs with beers and wines from their house. They make $12 a day. She is asking a loan of $1000 to increase capacity and sales volume. (Ben took pictured with her husband)

loan.use: To purchase beer and wine.

loan.name: Kung

texts.en:
Mrs. Kung C. lives in Pearaing village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has a 1-hectare plot on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She can't cultivate the field now because she does not have enough animals to plow the field. So she is requesting a loan to buy a second buffalo to plow with field with the old buffalo, and so be able to cultivate rice.

Her husband, Mr. Sela Meth, is a fisherman who gathers a few fish to support the family. Mrs. Kung C. is 28 years old and has two children; one attends the local school, and the other child is 2 years old.

loan.use: Buy a second buffalo to plow the field to cultivate rice

loan.name: Soun

texts.en: Soun R., 26, is married and lives together with her husband, their three children, and old mother (pictured in the photo) in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works at a garment factory, earning around US$4 a day, while her husband owns a motor-taxi business, making a daily profit of US$4. Soun R. now needs a loan of US$800 to open a new business. She will use this money to purchase music equipment to rent out to the villagers whenever they have a party or wedding.

loan.use: Purchase of music equipment

loan.name: Hou

texts.en: Hou S., 35, is a mother of two and, together with her husband, earns income buying rice crops from the growers and reselling them for a profit. She makes an average of US$10 per day. Each month, Hou S.'s family spends US$73 on food and US$12 on their childrens tuition. Some money is also spent on the treatment of her ailing mother. In order to increase the profit margin of her business, Hou S. would like to take out a loan to buy a larger volume of rice crops for re-sale.

loan.use: Purchase of rice crops for re-sale

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loan.name: Ven's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven I. is the leader of a group of five members, who all live in the Kaeng Ta Sok village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Ven I. owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She cannot cultivate rice now because she does not have enough rice seeds.

So she is requesting a loan to buy more rice seeds to plant. Her husband, Mr. H. Hom, helps her on the plantation. Mrs. Ven I. is 50 years old and has two children; one helps on the farm, and the other child attends the local school.

loan.use: Buy more rice seeds to plant

loan.name: Edickson

texts.en:
For the past three years, Edickson has been happily living in Barangay Magsaysay in Naguillan, Isabela with his wife Edelyn and daughter. Edickson works as a tricycle driver in his community. However, his income as a driver is not enough to support the needs of his family. As such, Edickson has decided to start a community-based variety store which will be managed by his wife.
The couple expects that this store will bring additional income for them and ultimately will help in sending their daughter and any future children to school. To realize this plan, Edickson is asking for a start up loan of PHP4,000 to purchase initial inventory of basic commodities such as sugar, coffee, biscuits, etc.
Edickson and Edelyn know that through hard work and by working together for the good of their family, nothing is impossible for them in achieving their dreams.

loan.use: Additional working capital

loan.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom S., 32, is married and lives with her two children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$5 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year; inflation, too, has soared. These factors have resulted in a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Mom S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she needs a loan of US$1,000 to purchase fertilizers for her farming business. Mom S. is confident that the loan will allow her to increase her daily income and be able to better support her family.

loan.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loan.name: Thim

texts.en: Thim M., 37, is married and lives with her 3 children in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 1990, she has been earning income teaching children at a local school, making about US$3 per day, while her husband, a policeman, has been making about US$5 per day. The couple is also being supported by two of their children who work as car drivers for private companies. Aside from being a teacher, Thim M. also makes income by selling gas and other necessities. At present, she needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to increase her business inventory and purchase more gas for sale.

loan.use: Increase of inventory and purchase of gas for sale

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Buy more rice seeds to plant

loan.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is married to Nkain Cletus, and they are blessed with six children, two of which are below 15 years of age. They live in a three-room house in Nanga-Street, a quarter in Bamenda-NW regions in Cameroon. Immaculate has decided to work extra hard to assist her husband to address the needs of such a big family. She has faced so many challenges in life such as inadequate funds to sustain her business project and ill health. These challenges made life uncomfortable for her, until 18th September 2007 when she discovered GHAPE and became a member. In that same year, Immaculate received her first loan of 40,000FRS and her repayment was successful. The profit she made was plowed back into her business capital of buying and selling.
Given a loan, she plans to buy firewood for 50,000FRS, dry corn and groundnuts for 46,500FRS, two buckets of groundnuts for 16,0000FRS, koki beans for 21,000FRS, two bags of salt, and magi for 27,500FRS and transportation for 29,000FRS. She plans to contribute 90,000FRS ($180 USD) of her own personal savings in order to carry out this business plan.
Immaculate will start repayments from the day the loan is disbursed. She is quite convinced the business will succeed because of her manner of approach to her customers, the way she usually displays her goods and the experience she is already having in the business. Her business will help her community through the taxes she will be paying will help to foster the economic growth in the area. With the profit from the business, she plans to pay her children school fees, and uses part to expand on her business. She prefer to receive loans from GHAPE because of the social education GHAPE due offers, and the method of repayment is convenient.

loan.use: Buying and selling of corn, Beans, and Groundnut.

loan.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin C. R. is married and has three children, all between 2 and 16 years old. The family lives in the Tboung Khmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Rin C. R. earns income selling various kinds of groceR. products, while her husband, Lai Phet, is a broker, buying rice crops from the growers and reselling them to vendors at a market. In a typical month, Rin C. R.'s family spends around US$41 on food and US$10 on their two schooling-age children's tuition. To make extra income for the household, Rin C. R. and her husband are now asking for a loan to be able to purchase a couple of pigs for breeding, learning from their neighbors who are already engaged in this type of business.

loan.use: Purchase of pigs for breeding

loan.name: Vat

texts.en: Vat L., 28, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who makes less than US$1 a day, while her husband is a farm worker making US$2 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this year, and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have resulted in a difficult year for many Cambodians, Vat L. included. In the context of these economic difficulties, she is currently asking for a loan of US$500 to be able to purchase a cow to help her plow the farmland.

loan.use: Purchase of a cow for plowing land

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Buy more grocery products for larger inventory in the store

loan.name: Roth

texts.en: Roth C., 43, lives with her old mother and earns income selling groceries and rice noodles. She sells rice noodles called Nom Banchok." They are used to prepare one of the favorite dishes in Cambodia and are typically served with different kinds of vegetables and herbs, including mint, banana blossoms, string beans, English cucumber, and mung bean sprouts. Rice noodles can also be used in two types of local soups - green and red soup. On average, Roth Chavin makes US$5 a day. At present, she needs a loan of US$400 to be able to increase her grocery inventory to respond to the increasing demand.

loan.use: Increase in inventory

loan.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali was born in 1966. He is married and lives in Khachmaz town. He transports goods with his car. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy wheels for winter and repair the motor of his car. He has 3 years of experience in this business.

loan.use: to buy wheels for winter and repair the motor of this car

loan.name: Vong's Group

texts.en: This is a group loan. Mrs. Vong S., 46, makes a living roasting bananas to sell in front of her house in her village to her neighbors. She has two young children; both in school. Her husband, Mr. Ty Chandara, 39, is a taxi driver who earns a salary $150 per month. To grow the business, S. is applying for a loan to purchase more bananas to roast and sell. S. is the leader of this group. Her group has three members: Mrs. Sos A., 37, a tailor. She requests a loan to buy more clothes for her business. Mrs. Kem S., 50, a local tailor. He seeks a loan to purchase sewing materials. Mrs. Vong M., 58, a vegetable seller. He seeks a loan to enlarge her business. They all live in Ratanak Commune in the Battambang Province.

loan.use: to purchase more bananas

loan.name: Relindis Bi

texts.en:
Relindis is married to Martine Ngo-ah and they have three children, all under 15. Being a very hard-working lady, she has been able to help her husband take good care of the family. Because of all this hard work, she has come across so many challenges in life such as being unable to feed the family, being a school dropout, and having inadequate funds to educate her children. Because of all these, she recognized GHAPE as a source of relief in the year 2007 and had her first loan of 40,000 FRS and the repayments were made correctly.

Given another loan, she plans to buy second-hand clothes for 100,000 FRS and traditional wear for 50,000 FRS. Her repayments will start from the date of disbursement. Because of the experience she has had in the business, she is sure the business will succeed. Her community will benefit from the business she is doing by having clothes at their disposal to buy, and she will improve the economic standard in her community.

Relindis plans to use the profit from her business to pay her children's school fees and improve the standard of living of her family. She prefers to borrow through GHAPE because of the trust she has in GHAPE, and the method of repayment is convenient.

loan.use: selling of second-hand clothes

loan.name: Chat

texts.en: Mrs. Chat S., 33, is widowed and has two children, 6 and 4 years old. There are four members in her family, including her younger god-sister. Chat S. owns a hairdressing shop at her home and is able to make US$3 per day. Aside from the beauty salon business, Chat S. is also involved in farming. She grows yams and sells the harvest to local vendors for profit. At times when the output from her own farm is low, she buys produce from other farmers to then re-sell it. At present, Chat S. has applied for a loan to be able to purchase an additional quantity of yams from other farmers for re-sale.

loan.use: Purchase of yams for re-sale

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loan.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is married to Leandro, a carpenter and farmer. They are blessed with three children who are all college graduates and already married. Their eldest is working as a salesman while their other two children are working as overseas contract workers or OFW.

Evangeline sells dry goods such as clothes, blankets, bed sheets, etc. Aside from that, she also sells frozen foods in their community. Though their children have already finished their studies, she and her husband are still working hard because they do not want to depend on their children to support them financially since they all have their own families to support.

At present, Evangeline is financially in need of PHP 9,000.00 to purchase additional inventory for her business. She intends to buy more frozen foods like hot dogs, tocino (a sweet pork dish), and longaniza (ground pork) to increase her profit. She is hoping that with her business, she and her husband can cope with their everyday needs and expenses. .

loan.use: additional capital for her small business

loan.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun S., 34, earns income selling various kinds of vegetables at a market, and selling porridge in the morning to the people in the area. She can typically make around US$5 per day, while her husband, working as a taxi-driver, earns about US$8 per day. In a typical month, Oun S.'s family spends US$40 on food and US$6 on utilities. For business purposes, S. uses a bicycle to transport the vegetables and other items to and from the market. At present, S. needs a loan to be able to purchase a motor-bike that could make her business more successful and would make her daily commute easier.

loan.use: Purchase of a motor-bike for a business

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loan.name: Mrs. Khoem Sat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people in Kampao Village in Takeo Province have formed a village bank to request a loan, and Mrs. Sat K. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She now does not have enough rice seeds to grow on the field. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds. She would use the rest of money to purchase piglets to start breeding pigs. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living standard. She is a 58-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while the other is a farmer to help their mother. Mr. Lay M. did not come to take the loan but his wife did, so she is present in the picture.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKs main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodias poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMKs client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: to buy rice seeds and piglets to start breeding pigs

loan.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok S., 56, is married and lives with her child in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1993, she has been selling groceries to earn a living, making US$5 per day, while her husband, Long Yen, 59, makes US$2.5 per day growing rice on a plot of farmland. Weather conditions this year have been difficult for farming in Cambodia, and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have resulted in a difficult year for many Cambodians, Long Yen included. Therefore, Mok S. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to purchase rice from other farmers for re-sale to a market whole-saler.

loan.use: Purchase of rice for re-sale

loan.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S. is 46 years old and a mother of three. She recently started her own business: she sells sugar cane juice on the street to the people in her community. Sugar cane juice has a refreshing, sweet-and-sour taste, and is a popular soft drink in South and Southeast Asia. In Cambodia, many sugar cane juice stands can be seen along the main roads. Sen S. has been involved in this business since 2006, and she typically makes around US$6 per day. One of her children, employed by a private company, earns US$7 per day, while the other two are still students. In a typical month, S.'s family spends US$50 on food, US$10 on utilities, and US$10 on their children's tuition. After hearing about CREDIT MFI from one of her neighbors, Mrs. Sen S. decided to apply for a loan to be able to buy a new sugar cane cart and an additional volume of sugar cane. She believes that the purchase will improve her business and make it more profitable.

loan.use: Purchase of sugar cane and a new sugar cane juice cart

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loan.name: Aem

texts.en:
Mr. Aem U. is a 42-year-old and he now lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Chan Doeun, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although they try to work hard to grow rice, they still can only get a little rice revenue to support their household.

In order to improve their income, Mr. Aem U. decided to ask for a loan to buy ice cream and an ice-cream box to start up a new business. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study. His wife is also present with him in the picture.

loan.use: to buy ice creams and an ice-cream box to start a new business

loan.name: Yashar

texts.en: This young man is single. He was born in 1981. Yashar lives in Khachmaz town. This kind man has been in this business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to increase the assortment of the foodstuffs to improve his business.

loan.use: To increase the assortment of the foodstuffs he sells

loan.name: Chrek

texts.en: Chrek T., 38, is married and has three children. The family lives in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Chrek T. earns income selling grocery items and raising pigs. She makes about US$11 per day, while her husband, Sut Koy, 41, works as a tractor driver, making around US$5 per day. At present, Chrek T. would like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a stock of gas for her husband's tractor.

loan.use: Purchase of gas for a tractor

loan.name: Ierb

texts.en:
Ierb S., 38, is married and lives with two of her children in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$ 2.70 each day and are supported by one child working in a garment factory.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Ierb S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a horse and a cart to transport goods and villagers. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family. (Her husband is pictured.)

loan.use: To purchase a horse and a cart to transport goods

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purchase more produce for a fruit and vegetable stand

loan.name: Siv

texts.en:
Mrs. Siv S., 41, is married with two children and lives with her husband in Tboung Khmom district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife, cooking food for her family members, while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver, earning typically US$ 7/day for his household. Her two children are currently employed by a factory and can collectively make around US$ 200 per month.

After hearing about CREDIT MFI from one of her neighbors who is a longtime CREDIT client, Siv S. would like to request a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to replace her husbands motor-bike, With any remainder of the loan she hopes to start up a grocery business at home.

loan.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to replace his old one

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loan.name: Hean

texts.en: Hean H. L., 59, is a widow who lives with eight of her children in Kampong Cham province. She uses her mill to take off rice husk for a profit. On average, she earns around US$ 6 a day and is also supported by six of her children. She would like to take out a loan of US$ 1200 to add to her stock of rice. This will increase the amount of rice she can husk each day.

loan.use: To purchase rice to husk for sale

loan.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
There are three borrowers in this group. Mrs. Rin S., 46, is a construction worker who works with her husband. She now cares for three children; one of her sons is employed, working with her. She is married to Mr. Nou Yong, 49, a construction supervisor who has workers providing his service, earning approximately US$ 4 a day. S. and Yong have decided to apply for a loan to buy more construction materials for their business. Other two borrowers are as follows:

Mrs. Thang C., age 62, who makes Khmer Cake for sale. She requests a loan to buy more ingredients to make the cakes.

Mrs. Ruom N., 40, is a teacher. She needs to earn additional income, so she is applying for a loan to purchase piglets to raise. They all live in Chrey Commune in Battambang Province.

loan.use: to buy more construction materials

loan.name: Mr. Seik Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who live in Kampao village in Takeo province make up a village bank loan with Mr. Seik K. as its President. He is a gathers palm juice to process it into palm sugar or wine. His wife, Mrs. Kim Oun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from the plantation, she is a pig breeder. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn less income to provide a better life for their family. In order to improve the living conditions, Mr. Seik K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for his wife's business and bamboos to be tied to the palm trees to make climbing easy for him when he gathers juice. He is a 36-year old father of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.
This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. The 12 members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMKs main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodias poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term.

loan.use: To buy more piglets for his wife's business and bamboos to be tied to the palm trees to make climbing easy for him when he gathers juice.

loan.name: Juana Confesora's Group
loan.use: Purchase of tablecloths and window curtains to operate a small business.

loan.name: Fizuli

texts.en: Fizuli is a single man who lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. He was born in 1960. He has been in the business of transporting goods for 2 years. He is currently seeking a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts he needs to improve his transport business.

loan.use: to buy spare parts

loan.name: Hen

texts.en:
Mrs. Hen H. is a villager in Ty Buon village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells bamboo. Her husband, Mr. You Me, uses a horse with a cart to transport passengers. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn insufficient income to provide a better life for their family.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Hen H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to be a motorbike taxi driver. She is 35 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loan.use: to buy a motorbike to be a motorbike taxi driver

loan.name: Numfor

texts.en:
T. is 46 years old, married and a mother of six children. With inadequate parental support during her own childhood, she could not make it through secondary education. She was also emotionally disturbed when her father died. Finally, T. was seriously ill and she struggled to recover from it.
She them decided to do work in pig farming, which is less strenuous, and operate a medicine store at the same time. She joined GHAPE at this juncture in her life and, after obtaining training in business management, she obtained his first loan in 1999. Since that time, she has taken and repaid several loans, built a pig farm, and been able to raise money to provide basic needs for her family.
Given a loan, she plans to continue rearing piglets and buy feeds for them. With the profit she will be able to maintain her house and expand the medicine store .
She plans to pay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement

loan.use: Purchase piglets, feed, rent site, medicines, fowls

loan.name: Etibar

texts.en: Etibar M. was born in 1974. He is single, and lives in a town called Khachmaz. Three years ago, he started a business of transporting goods. He currently needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for improving his transportation business.

loan.use: To buy spare parts

loan.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline Man, marie, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut un prt pour renforcer son commerce de tissus teints. Elle achte le bazin et les produits chimiques pour faire la teinture et vendre des draps. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer aux charges familiales. Le prt quelle sollicite sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Man, married and raising 6 children, has been a member of the village bank of Manguiline Santhiaba for 7 and a half years. She wants a loan to bolster her tie-dyed cloth business. She buys "bazin" (damask cloth) and the chemicals necessary to do the dyeing and then sells the tie-dyed cloth. Her income permits her to contribute to the family's living expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.d

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of cloth and chemicals for tie-dyeing cloth for sale

loan.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama D., veuve avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de lgumes et divers quelle effectue entre Bignona et Mbour. Ses revenus lui permettent de se prendre en charge mdicalement et damliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prt qui sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance.
texts.en:
Adama D., a widow raising 2 children, has been a member of the village bank of Manguiline Santhiaba for seven and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling vegetables, etc. between Bignona and Mbour. Her income permits her to pay her medical expenses and improve living conditions for her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: selling vegetables etc.

loan.name: Chico Caero

texts.pt:
Chico nasceu em Sofala, tem 33anos, Pai de um filho de 1ano e 8meses. Mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da Swazilndia logo que entrou no mercado de emprego como professor.
Aps a concluso do ensino elementar Chico entregou se para fazer a escola de formao de padres catlicos na sua pronvicia. Anos depois, apois de concluir 3ano do nivel superior pela mesma escola j em Maputo, este abandona alegando no aquentar com as exigncias do curso. Em 2002 chico contratado na educao para ser professor da lingua partuguesa da 9classe e foi afecto na Escola Secundria de Namaacha, onde trabalha at ento como efectivo das 12h s 17:30h. vive maritalmente com a sua esposa Lcia de 24 anos que est a fazer o curso de formao de professores, vive numa casa alugada e com seu dois sobrinhos uma com 17anos e outro com 6anos a mais venha vai a escola. Chico tem um salario de 4,700.00mt,apesar de muintas dispesas ainda consegue poupar 500.00mt por ms com o valor da poupana Chico conseguiu comprar um terreno em Boane para constuir a sua residncia,mas com o custo elevado de vida no conseguia iniciar com a obra, em 2007 conheceu a Hluvuku logo que estalou a sucursal em Namaacha e teve a opurtunidade de obter um finaciamento.
Este o segundo emprestimo do Chico com a Hluvuku e o primeiro com Kiva, o primeiro de 15,000.00mt foram usados na compra de material de construo para iniciar com a obra e este segundo de 20,000.00mt seram tambem usados para mesmo fim. Est confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo determinado e solicitar outro emprestimo para construir uma barraca na sua residncia onde vai vender produtos da primeira nessecidade como forma de aumentar a renda familiar. Futuramente Chico pretende concluir com seu estudos para ter um salario estavel.
texts.en:
Chico was born in Sofala, is 33 years old and the father of a 1 year and 8 month old son. He moved to Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland and entered the job market as a teacher.

After completing elementary school, Chico began at a school for catholic priests in his province. Years later, after completing the 3rd year of the superior level in the same school in Maputo, he abandoned his studies, alleging that he could not handle the demands of the course. In 2002, Chico was s hired as a 9th grade Portuguese Language teacher at the Escola Secundria de Namaacha (Secondary School of Namaacha) where he works from midday to 5:30pm. He lives with his wife Lcia, who is 24 years old and taking a teacher training course. They live in a rented house with two nephews one is 17 years old and the other is 6 the oldest of whom goes to school.

Chico has a salary of 4700 MZN and despite having a lot of expenses, he still manages to save 500 MZN a month and has managed to buy a piece of land in Boane with his savings on which to build his own house. However, due to the high cost of living he hasnt managed to begin the construction and in 2007 when he came across Hluvuku when they opened a branch in Namaacha and was able to obtain financing.

This is Chicos second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan, for 15000 MZN, was used to purchase construction materials to begin the building works and this second loan, for 20,000 MZN, will be used for the same purpose. He is confident that he will pay it back before it is due and will request another loan to build a stall at his house from which he will sell necessities in order to increase his familys income. In the future, Chico intends to complete his studies so that he can have a stable salary.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of construction material

loan.name: Ndiembatt

texts.fr: Ndiembatt M., marie avec 05 enfants sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba depuis 1 an et demi. Son activit consiste acheter et revendre des produits forestiers (citron, huile de palme) et des arachides. Elle veut renforcer son commerce qui lui permet davoir des revenus pour aider amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prt qui sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance.
texts.en:
Ndiembatt M., married and raising 5 children, has been a member of the village bank of Manguiline Santhiaba for a year and a half. Her business is buying and re-selling forest products (lemons, palm oil) and peanuts. She wants to bolster her little business which affords her income to help improve the living conditions of her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months, in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buying and re-selling lemons, palm oil, and peanuts

loan.name: Pascoal Raul

texts.pt:
Pascoal was born in Inhambane, is 30 years old and was in school until the 8th grade. He is married with 3 children: the first child is 8 years old, the second is 3 and the last is 5 months old only the oldest is in school.

After his birth, Pascoal leaves Inhambane for Namaacha a village on the border with Swaziland with his mother, who was following her husband who worked in that district. Six years later Pascoal begins his studies and has to stop when he reaches the 8th grade due to his fathers death, given that it was he who paid for Pascoals studies. Life becomes hard and being the oldest child of the household, he finds himself forced to work. In 1995 he finds a job at the Hotel Libombos as a bar man and works from 7am to 3pm on the morning shift and from 3pm to 11pm on the night shift. He is a permanent employee and makes 2600 MZN a month but he doesnt save any money because as well as building his house he is responsible for his two brothers who live with him.

This is Pascoals first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. These 10,000 MZN will be used to buy construction materials to finish building his house. He is confident that he will repay his loan before it is due and because its not easy to live off his salary, he aims to ask for another loan for the construction of a stall that will help increase his familys income.

Translated from Portuguese, Brazil by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

Pascoal nasceu em inhambane, tem 30 anos de idade estudou ate a 8 classe vive maritalmente pai de 3 filhos: o primeiro de 8 anos a segunda de 3 anos e a ultima de 5 meses, somente o mais velho e que se encontra a estudar.

Aps a sua nascncia Pascual sai de Iinhambane a Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da Swazilndia com sua me , esta que ia atras do seu marido que se encontrava a trabalhar naquele distrito. Seis anos depois Pascoal comea a estudar e teve que parar na 8 classe devido a morte do seu pai este que custeava os seus estudos, a vida fica dificil e sendo filho mais velho da casa v se obrigado a trabalhar, ento em 1995 consegue aranjar um emprego no Hotel Libombos como bar man, Trabalha das 7.00h as 15.00h no periodo da manha e das 15.00h as 23.00h no periodo da noite. trabalhador efectivo e aufere mansalmente um valor de 2.600.00mt no consegue poupar nenhum valor porque alm de estar a concluir a sua obra responsabiliza se pelos seus 2 irmos estes que vivem com ele em sua casa.

Este e o primiro emprstimo de Pascoal na Hluvuku e Kiva. Estes 10.000.00mt seram usados para comprar material de construao para concluir com a sua obra. Esta confiante de que vai reembolsar antes do prazo determinado porque no e facil viver de salrio tem como objectivo pedir outro emprstimo para contruao de um pequeno estabelecimento comercial que lhe vai ajudar a aumentar a renda familiar.

loan.use: Purchase construction material

loan.name: Nkemchob

texts.en:
Born in 1960, E. is married to Nkemchop Mathias with six children. She is a hard working woman with six children to look after. She says being a mother of six is more difficult than being a spinster. The death of her supportive parents kept her in the cold. She now has to start doing some of those things her parents would always do, which she took for granted, with her husband. Challenged by these realities she has double her effort towards meeting the needs of his children. This made her to join GHAPE.
Given a loan, she plans to expand her business and pay school fees for her children. Her community will also benefit from her activities as she will have to provide them with necessary food items. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months.

loan.use: To purchase of corn, beans, groundnuts oil and firewood

loan.name: Anastancia Lina

texts.pt:
Anastncia nasceu em sofala, tem 35 anos de idade estudou ate a 10 classe vive maritalmente e me de 3 filhos: o primeiro rapaz de 21 anos, a sugunda uma rapariga de 19 anos e ultimo um menino de 11 anos, somente o mais novo e que se encontra a estudar.
Anastncia sai da beira a maputo quando tinha apenas 2 anos com a sua me apois esta ter se separado do seu esposo, a me cria lhe com muita dificuldade deste modo ela demora engressar na escola e inicia os estudos com 10 anos. Quando j tinha 14 anos esta fica gravida e enterrompe os seus estudos passando assim a viver em casa do seu marido, anos depois separa se do seu esposo e consequentemente consegue aranjar um emprego na escola militar de musica como praa e consegue se enguadrar no Ministrio do Interior, em 1994 foi desmobilizada e em seguida entra na polcia. afectada no distrito de Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilandia como guarda fronteira, trabalha em turnos sem dias fixos das 7h as 15h no perido da manh e das 12h as 20h no perido da noite horrio esse em que feicham a fronteira, tem um salrio mensal de 4.103.46mt no consegue poupar nenhum valor porque alm de estar a concluir a sua obra responsabiliza se pelos seus 2 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa e pela sua me que vive em manhia mandado lhe em cada 3 mses um valor de 1.000.00mt
Este o segundo emprstimo de anastncia na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. Os 10.000.00mt foram usados na compra de material para iniciar a sua obra e este segundo de 10.000.00mt seram usados para o mesmo fim. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo determinado e solicitar um outro emprstimo para abrir um salo de belesa como forma de aumentar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Anastncia was born in Sofala. She is 35 years old and studied until the 10th grade. She is married and the mother of 3 children: her first son is 21 years old, her daughter is 19, and the youngest is an 11 year-old boy. Only the youngest is a student. Anastncia left Beira for Maputo when she was only 2 years old with her mother after she had separated with her husband. Her mother raised her with great difficulty and had to delay enrolling her in school until she was 10 years old. When she was only 14 she became pregnant and had to interrupt her studies. She went to live in the home of her husband. Years later she separated from her husband and consequently was able to arrange a job in a military music school. She then found a place in the Ministry of the Interior. In 1994 she was discharged and entered the police force. She is positioned as a border guard in the district of Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland. She works in shifts without fixed days from 7:00am to 3:00pm on the morning shift and from 12:00pm until 8:00pm on the night shift when they close the border. She has a monthly salary of 4,103.46MT and is unable to save any money because she is also responsible for her 2 grandchildren who both live with her in her home. She also cares for her mother who lives in Manhia and sends her 1,000MT every 3 months. This is her second loan through Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The 10,000MT was used to purchase materials to begin her work, and this second 10,000MT will be used to the same end. She is confident that she will pay off the loan before the maturity date so she can solicit another loan to open a beauty salon and increase her family income.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase construction materials

loan.name: Phebe

texts.en:
Born in 1955, Phebe is married and has seven children. She is proud that she and her husband were married in a traditional ceremony, to which she attributes their good luck that they were blessed with so many children. Unfortunately, her husband is dead.
With her previous loans from GHAPE, Phebe succeeded in growing and providing her community with cassava and ndjamadjama (huckleberry leaves -- a popular green vegetable). Given a loan, she plans to buy fresh manure, fertilizer, seedlings and chemicals to expand and improve her farm. She also intends to buy piglets to fatten and sell for their meat. She plans to repay the entire loan in 24 months.

loan.use: To buy fresh manure, fertilizer, seedlings and chemicals to expand and improve her farm

loan.name: Mukangamije

texts.en:
"Amakuru!" ("Hello!") from E. in Rwanda. E. is 47 years old, and the widow of three children.
E. started her business in 2005. With borrowed capital of 150,000 Frws from a family friend, she started a mini supermarket selling items such as: rice, powdered milk, cooking oil, Colgate, rice, maize flour, cassava flour, etc. She has currently employed one person to help with her business.
Because of her business, she has been able to send her three children to school. The eldest is currently studying at University and the younger two are in high school. Her long-term plan is to have all her children complete University.
She is looking for a loan of 500,000 Frws to increase her inventory in the supermarket. This loan would be repaid in 8 months.

loan.use: Increase her inventory

loan.name: Albino Govene

texts.pt: Albino nasceu em Gaza, tem 59 anos de idade estudou ate 2 classe do antigo sistema pai de 3 filhos: com idades compriendidas entre os 22 aos 17 anos de idade, as duas mais velhas encontram-se no lar e a mais nova e que vai a escola. Albino iniciou os seus estudos com 15 anos, aps concluir a 2 classe teve que interroper os estudos devido aos maus tratos dos seus professores na escola, pois ele no era assimilado porque os seus progenitores no tinham condies finnceiras pois estes eram camponess. Sai de chkwe para Maputo a procura de emprego.chegado a maputo consegue aranjar um emprego no Hotel Rovuma como servente e trabalhou durante 5 anos, porque o salrio no satisfazia as suas necessidades, abandona o emprego apos ter tido uma proposta para trabalhar no Hotel Libombos em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia, trabalhou durante 2 anos porque no havia um bom ambiente de trabalho pois os colegas alegavam que o cargo que ele ocupava no lhe marecia e assim teve que abandonar o emprego. Mas com o fundo colectado e com ajuda da sua mulher esta que modista, albino inicia o seu prprio negcio de alfaiataria e sapataria, uma actividade que aprende com as irms missionarias quando ainda frenquentava a escola. Hoje dono de uma sapataria e alfaiataria denominada chapo-chapo trabalha das 7h as 18h excepto quartas e sabados porque tem estado no mercado imformal que funciona 2 vezes por semana, tem tido mais rendimento nos sapatos pois solicitam muito os seus servicos principalmente no tempo chuvoso pois os sapatos descolam se com frequncia devido a lama argilosa que se faz sentir naquela poca. Tem tido um lucro mensal de 5.000.00mt e consegue poupar 1.500.00mt porque no responsabiliza se por ninguem pois ele e o nico na familia que sobriviveu na guerra dos 16 anos. Este o segundo emprstimo de albino na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. O primeiro de 5.000.00mt usou para comprar uma maquina de engrachar sapatos e pede este segundo de 11.000.00mt para comprar uma maquina de costura, pois no inicio do ano tem tido muitas encomendas de uniforme escolar e pretende satisfazer as necessidaes dos clientes na totalidade e render mais ainda.
texts.en:
Albino was born in Gaza. He is 59 years old. He went to school until the 2nd grade under the old system. He is the father of 3 children with ages between 17 and 22. The two oldest are at home, and the youngest is in school. Albino began his studies when he was 15 years old, but after finishing the 2nd grade he had to interrupt school due to the bad treatment from his teachers at his school. Of course he was not very assimilated because his ancestors did not have the financial conditions being that they were country folk. He left Chkwe for Maputo in search of work. Having arrived in Maputo he was able to arrange a job at the Hotel Rovuma as a servant and worked for 5 years. Because he salary did not satisfy his necessities he abandoned his job after having had a proposal to work in the Hotel Libombos in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland. He only worked there 2 years because it was not a very good work environment. His colleagues alleged that he did not deserve the responsibilities he was given and he had to leave. But with the funds collected and with the help of his mother who is a dressmaker, Albino started his own tailor and shoe shop, an activity that he learned from the sister missionaries when he was still attending school. Today he is the owner of a shoe store and tailor called "Chapo-Chapo". He works from 7:00am until 6:00pm except on Wednesdays and Saturdays because he goes to the informal market 2 times per week. He makes more income from the shoes. Of course many people need his services during the rainy season because the shoes become unglued frequently due to the muddy clay that made sense during that time. He has had a monthly income of 5,000MT and is able to save 1,500MT because he is not responsible for anyone else. He is the only one in his family that survived the 16 year war. This is Albino's second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan of 5,000MT was used to purchase a machine to clean shoes, and he is asking for this second loan of 11,000MT to purchase a sewing machine because since the beginning of the year he has had many orders for school uniforms, and he intends to satisfy the necessities of his customers in full and bring in more money as well.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase sewing machine

loan.name: Hilrio Xavier

texts.pt:
Hilario nasceu em inhambane , tem 34 anos de idade estudou ate a 11 classe vive maritalmente e pai de 3 filhos: o primeiro de 8 anos , o segundo de 5 anos e o ultimo e um recem nascido de apenas 2 semanas. Os dois mais velhos e que se encontram a estudar Hilrio sai de V. a Beira com seus pais este que era militar quando tinha apenas 2 aninhos vive durante 15 anos onde consegue fazer a 6 classe, o seu pai transferido para trabalhar como guarda civil em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilndia e este vem com a sua familia. Chegado a Namaacha continua com seus estudos e faz a 11 classe, porque o custo de vida sobe cada dia que passa , Hilario pede emprestado um valor no seu tio e comeca a praticar o seu prprio negcio de venda de calados no mercado informal da Namaacha (vulgo shoprite) que funciona 2 vezes por semana e consegue entao construir a sua prpria casa. Anos depois e contratado para trabalhar na Moseg como seguranca da TDM no mesmo distrito, sendo assim teve que interroper com os negcios pois o horario de trabalho conscidia com os dias da venda e assim entra na falncia. Hoje trabalhador da Moseg aufere um valor mensal de 1.800.00mt trabalhando em turnos, um periodo de 24h por dia 3 vezes por semana. No consegue poupar nenhum valor pois ganha pouco e esta a concluir a sua obra, em 2007 conhece a hluvuku logo que estalou a sua sucursal em Namaacha e teve a oportunidade de obter um emprestimo no valor de 7.000.00mt.
Este e o segundo emprstimo de Hilario na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva . o primeiro de 7.000.00mt foram usados para comprar calados, estes que revendia no mercado imformal antes de comear a trabalhar e pede este segundo de 10.000.00mt para comprar material de construao esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do periodo determinado e pedir outro emprstimo para construir uma barraca na sua residncia para vender produtos de primeira necessidade.
texts.en:
Hilario was born in Inhambane and is 34 years old. He studied until the 11th grade. He is married and the father of 3 children: the first is 8 years old, the second is 5, and the youngest is a new born of only 2 weeks. The two oldest kids are students. Hilario left V. for Beira with his parents who were in the miltary when he was only 2 years old. He lived there for 15 years and was able to complete the 6th grade. His father was transferred to work as a policeman in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, and he came with his family. Arriving in Namaacha he was able to continue with his schooling and completed the 11th grade. Since the cost of living was increasing every day Hilario borrowed money from his uncle and began his own business selling shoes in the informal market of Namaacha (known as Shoprite) that operates 2 times per week. He was able to construct his own home. Years later he was contracted to work in the Moseg as security of TDM in the same district. Because of this he had to interrupt his business since his work schedule conflicted with the market days, and that caused him to go bankrupt. Today he is a worker for Moseg, and he earns monthly salary of 1,800MT working in shifts, one period of 24 hours per day 3 times per week. He is unable to save any money because he earns so little. In 2007 he found out about Hluvuku as soon as they opened a branch in Namaacha, and he had the opportunity to obtain a loan for 7,000MT. This is Hilario's second loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan of 7,000MT was used to purchase shoes that he would resell at the informal market before work, and he is asking for this second loan of 10,000MT to purhase construction materials. He is confident that he can repay this loan before its term so he can request another loan in order to construct a stand in his home to sell various staple products.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase construction materials

loan.name: Uwineza

texts.en:
Greetings from M. C. in Kigali city the capital of Rwanda! M. is 22 years old and married with two children, one adopted.
M. C. started her business some time back with her capital of 300 Frws. She accumulated savings of 4500 Frws (8$) and started a new business of selling spinach (cassava leaves commonly called Isombe), avocados and bananas, carrying them on her head in the basket. As her business grew, she was able to switch to a more profitable business, selling shirts in the local markets as a hawker.
She is currently selling shoes in a closed shop. She buys them from Uganda in bulk since they are cheap compared to Rwanda. She has been able to pay her school fees throughout secondary school from her business proceeds.
She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Frws to increase her stock of shoes. She is expecting high sales during this Christmas festival and as students are starting school again next month. This loan would be repaid over 8 months on a monthly basis. Her dream is to raise funds to go to university to study business.

loan.use: Increase her stock

loan.name: Wally Suma Group

texts.es: En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Juan Pablo II, a ste pertenece la asociacin Wally Suma (lengua aymar que significa; bastante rico) Casadas en su mayora y con un promedio de cuatro hijos, se vieron en la necesidad de buscar un negocio propio, que les permita obtener ingresos diarios en sus hogares. Dentro el grupo la mayora tienen negocios individuales, siendo las mas comunes; la venta de comida y venta de ropa. Realizan viajes al Desaguadero (localidad de La Paz) llevando mercadera para comercializarla all y tambin compran productos de all para comercializarlas al detalle en las ferias de la ciudad. La asociacin Wally Suma necesita de mayor capital para ampliar sus ventas, debe comprar mercadera en mayor cantidad, de este modo genera mayores ingresos que les permita cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
The Juan Pablo II focal center is located in the city of El Alto, and in this center the association Wally Suma (which in the Aymara language means Rich Enough) meets. As most are married with an average of four children, the association members have found it necessary to have their own businesses which allow them to provide daily income for their homes. Within the group the majority have individual businesses, most of which sell food and clothes. They travel to Desaguadero (a town in La Paz) bringing wholesale merchandise to sell and also buying products there to sell at retail value at fairs in the city. The Wally Suma association needs more capital to increase sales. By buying greater quantities of merchandise they will generate more income that will enable them to cover their basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of wholesale merchandise

loan.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La seora Vilma vive en casa de sus suegros con su hija en la calle ngel Dvalos de la Zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz ; la actividad que realiza es la venta de productos de belleza marca Yambal y productos Bata. Con esta actividad ella mantiene a su hija y puede cubrir sus necesidades de alimentacin y estudios ya que esta separa da del esposo por varios aos.
El crdito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, as poder comprar ms mercadera y mejorar sus ingresos.
El historial de pagos de Vilma es muy bueno y por lo tanto influye muchsimo para su calificacin y aprobacin de un nuevo crdito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma lives with her daughter in her in-laws house on ngel Dvalos Street in the Alto San Pedro district of La Paz city; she sells products from the beauty line Yambal and the Bata catalog. With this work she supports her daughter and covers food and school expenses, since she has been separated from her husband for many years. The loan she is asking for is to increase her capital so that she can buy more merchandise and improve her income. Vilmas payment history is very good, which qualifies her for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of more beauty products for her business.

loan.name: Mario

texts.es: El seor Mario M. vive en casa propia, en la zona de Liman Pata, ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la seora Graciela Tincuta y sus cuatro hijos. El seor Mario trabaja como chofer de transporte publico en la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa elabora empanadas, las que vende en un puesto ambulante. La vivienda que habita aun no esta concluida totalmente, ya que se ha construido las habitaciones y el ingreso al garaje. El crdito ser para la conclusin del muro del cerco Sur de su vivienda. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita prstamo y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder a un crdito.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario M. lives in his own house in the Liman Pata district, located outside La Paz city, with his wife Mrs. Graciela Tincuta and their four children. Mario works as a public transportation driver in La Paz city and his wife makes empanadas, which she sells from a cart. The construction of their house is not finished; thus far they have built bedrooms and a driveway. The loan will be to finish the wall surrounding the south side of their house. This is their fourth loan request and the socioeconomic analysis conducted on their application qualifies them to receive another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Construction of wall surrounding his house.

loan.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Hello from Theogene N. from Rwanda! Theogene is 26 years old, married with one child and has one adopted orphan.
Theogene runs a butcher business where he sells beef to the local people. He has a shop where he employs 2 people to help him run the business. A kilogram of beef costs 1800 Frws ($3), and Theogene sells about 350 kilograms a day.
Theogene is requesting a loan of 500,000 Frws to be repaid in 8 months. He wants to buy two cows to slaughter during The Christmas festivals with the aim is to expand his business.

loan.use: Buy two cows to slaughter during Christmas festivals.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Purchase of pig food to sell in the community

loan.name: Asombang

texts.en: P. is married and has four children. She is proud of having children with her husband. She was so disturbed when all her children were sick and some members of her family, who were very supportive in providing needs of her family, died. She made up her mind to turn to GHAPE for loan in other to help and care for herself. With her previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with cassava, manure, groundnut, egusi (a popular protein-rich seed used for soups) , and yams. Given a loan, she plans to buy egusi, beans, fertilizer, and chemicals to expand her farming. She intend opening an account for herself with the profit. She plans to repay the entire loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loan.use: Purchase of seedlings, manure, and tools

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Purchase of clothing to sell during the holidays

loan.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Doa Mara Luisa cuenta con 63 aos de edad, es casada de oficios tejedora, elaboracin de Fajas tpicas para mujeres cuenta con un taller de 5 telares, habita junto a sus hijos, cuentan con Cinco empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 18 aos de elaborar fajas en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chichaclan, Cantn Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapn, Guatemala, actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones econmicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razn acudi a la Asociacin ASDIR, a solicitar un prstamo, con la intencin de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Doa Maria Luisa, at 63 years of age, is still working as a weaver engaged in the production of traditional womens sashes. She works in a workshop of five looms and employees engaged in the same activity. She has been weaving sashes for 18 years. She lives close to her children in her residence which is in Paraje Chichaclan, Cantn Poxlajuj, in the Department of Totonicapn, Guatemala. Nowadays, the demand of her customers has grown but the economic circumstances have not been sufficient for her to accumulate her working capital. For that reason, she approached Asociacin ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of buying raw materials, and thus increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working Capital, Weaving

loan.name: Florinda Agustina

texts.es: Doa Florinda Agustina de 33 aos de edad, es casada de oficios, Artesana Confeccin de Delantales para mujeres, cuenta con un taller de 3 mquinas, habita junto a sus hijos, y con su esposo cuentan con Dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 10 aos de confeccionar delantales en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chichaclan, Cantn Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapn, Guatemala, actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones econmicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razn acudi a la Asociacin ASDIR, a solicitar un prstamo, con la intencin de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando tambin poder sacar adelante a sus hijos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doa Florinda Agustina is 33 years of age. She is an artisan by trade, engaged in the preparation of womens aprons She lives with her children, and she and her husband work in a shop with three machines, along with two other employees. She has been making aprons for 10 years in her residence which may be found in Paraje Chichaclan, Cantn Poxlajuj, in the Department of Totonicapn, Guatemala. At present, her customer demand has grown but the economic conditions she has encountered have not allowed her to accumulate her working capital. For that reason, she turned to the Asociacin ASDIR to solicit a loan with the intention of buying raw materials, and thus increase her sales. She is also hoping to bring up her children in order to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of Raw Materials (Crafts)

loan.name: Rosalinda Matea

texts.es: La Seora Rosalinda Matea de 29 aos de edad, casada de oficios Artesana Elaboracin de Fajas Tpicas para mujeres cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a sus hijos, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, desde su niez se dedicaba en la Artesana gracias a los prstamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en Paraje Chichaclan el Cantn Poxlajuj del municipio y departamento de Totonicapn, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociacin Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima de dicha Artesana; de esa manera facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y as poder darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Seora Rosalinda Matea is 29 years old. She works as an artisan in the production of traditional womens sashes. She works in a three-loom workshop with two other employees engaged in the same activity. Since childhood she has been devoted to this craft. Thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to carry her family forward. She is well known where she lives, with her children, in Paraje Chichaclan, Municipality and Department of Totonicapn, Guatemala. Rosalinda has come to the Asociacin ASDIR for financing to purchase raw materials for her craft. In this way, she will be able to provide for and meet the demands of her customers, and thus be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Raw Materials for Hand Crafts

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Purchase of goods to sell

loan.name: Rosario Cristina

texts.es: La Seorita Rosario Cristina de 24 aos de edad, Soltera de oficios Estudiante Compra y Venta de Ropa Tpica para mujeres, cuentan con un pequeo negocio, desde su niez se dedicaba al Comercio gracias a los prstamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Chichaclan, Cantn Poxlajuj del municipio y departamento de Totonicapn, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociacin Asdir un financiamiento para la compra y venta de ropa tpica, dicho Comercio para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y as poder incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosario Cristina is 24 years old and single. She has a small business buying and selling traditional women's clothing. She has worked in this field since she was young, thanks to loans that helped her family get ahead. Rosario lives in the Chichaclan neighborhood of the Poxlajuj district of Totonicapn, Guatemala, and is very well-known there.

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner Asociacin ASDIR in order to help her buy and sell traditional clothing. This investment will enable her to successfully meet her clients' demand, and thereby increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy traditonal clothing

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purchase fresh meat to retail in her community.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Purchase of materials to operate an upholsterer's shop.

loan.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene una oficina en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz y se dedica a la comercializacin de tintas y cintas para impresoras. Tambin realiza mantenimiento de computadora e impresoras. Su esposa es profesora y trabaja con su hijo. Vive en la Zona central de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crdito, su comportamiento es bueno en el pago de sus cuotas El crdito ser destinado para la compra de mercadera (tintas y cintas en cantidad)
texts.en:
Juan Carlos has an office in the downtown area of the city of La Paz where dedicates his time to the marketing of ink and print ribbons for printers. He also does maintenance for computers and printers. His wife is a teacher and he works with his son. Juan Carlos lives in the downtown area of the city of La Paz. This is the third time he has sought a loan and he has a history of making his loan payments on time. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (ink and print ribbons in bulk).

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos vive en la avenida Jos Maria Prez de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado, su esposa trabaja en un consultorio odontolgico.
Juan Carlos trabaja como chofer de transporte publico en el sindicato Simn Bolvar,prestando servicio con la movilidad que es de su propiedad
El crdito lo destinara en la reparacin de motor y cambio de llantas.
Es el segundo crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crdito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives on Jose Maria Perez avenue in the city of La Paz. He is married and his wife works in an odontology office.

Juan Carlos works as a public transportation driver for the "Simon Bolivar" union, offering his services using his own means of transportation.

The loan will be used to repair the engine and purchase new tires.

This is his second loan through Impro, whose assessment determined that he is qualified to to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Auto Repair

loan.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz vive en el Pasaje Patio de la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz junto a su madre y hermanos
Trabaja en el sindicato Simn Bolvar,prestando servicio como secretaria.
El crdito lo destinara en la compra de materiales de construccin para la reparacin de una de sus paredes de su vivienda, ya que por esta temporada de lluvia tuvo varias rajaduras.
Es el primer crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crdito.
texts.en:
Mary Luz lives with her mother and siblings in Pasaje Patio in the Achachicala zone of the city of La Paz.

She works for the "Simon Bolivar" union as a secretary.

The loan will be used to purchase construction materials to repair a wall in her apartment, which developed cracks during the rainy season.

This is her first loan through Impro, whose assessment determined that she is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To repair a wall in her aparment

loan.name: Francisco Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge vive en la calle Santa Brbara de la ciudad de La Paz junto a su esposa y su hija menor de 10 aos de edad. Su esposa trabaja como cocinera en una pensin.
Jorge es chofer de transporte publico en el sindicato Simn Bolvar,la movilidad es de su propiedad
El crdito lo destinara en la compra de batera y llantas.
Es el primer crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crdito.
texts.en:
Jorge lives on Santa Brbara road in La Paz with his wife and his young 10-year old daughter. His wife works as a cook in a boardinghouse. Jorge is a public transportation driver with the Simn Bolvar union; he owns the car he drives for work. He will use the loan to buy a battery and tires. This is his first loan with Impro; the assessment carried out qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To fix his car, which he uses in his capacity as a public transportation driver.

loan.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Victor Hugo vive en la calle Mario Alborta de la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz junto a su esposa y sus dos hijo de 13 y 7 aos respectivamente, su esposa trabaja como enfermera particular.
Victor es chofer asalariado de transporte publico en el sindicato Simn Bolvar,
El crdito lo destinara en la reparacin de techo de la habitacin de sus hijos ya que por temporada de lluvia tiene algunas filtraciones
Es el segundo crdito con Impro y el segundo va KIVA la evaluacin realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crdito.
texts.en:
Victor Hugo lives on Mario Alborta Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 13 and 17. His wife works as a private nurse. Victor is a salaried public transportation driver in the Simn Bolvar union.

Victor is requesting a loan to repair the ceiling of his children's room, which leaks in the rainy season. This is his second loan funded by Kiva lenders via IMPRO. As he fulfilled his responsibilities in repaying the first loan, he is qualified to receive another.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Home Repair

loan.name: Miguel

texts.es: El seor Miguel Garca es padre de familia y como tal desea lo mejor para sus hijos. Con dos crditos anteriores de FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le faltan los acabados interiores. Est solicitando un prstamo para terminar la mejora y planea pagarlo con los ingresos que obtiene en una iglesia, como guardia e intendente. l y su esposa la seora Rosala Gmez desean que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto para que estn cmodos y felices. En el momento de la visita no se encontraba Don Miguel, estaba trabajando, ya que practicamente pasa muy poco tiempo en su casa por los tipos de empleo que tiene (ya mencionados en este texto). Llega muy tarde y por tal motivo solo sale su esposa en la fotografa.
texts.en:
Miguel Garca is a father and as such wants the best for his children. With two previous loans from FVP, he has built a room but there are still the exterior finishes to be done. He is asking for this loan in order to complete the home improvements and will repay the loan with the income he makes at a church, as a guard and manager. He and his wife, Rosala Gmez, would like their children to have their own room so that they can be comfortable and happy. Miguel is rarely home because of the many jobs he has, so pictured above is his wife, since he was not available at the time of the visit..

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To finish the exterior of his home

loan.name: Jess Antonio

texts.es: El seor Jess Antonio C., vive con su hijo y su esposa. Ya tiene su casita, pero el detalle es que solo tienen una recamara, est construyendo un cuarto en la casa pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario pagar la mano de obra, con el material no tuvo problema, lo fue comprando poco a poco. l est solicitando para empezar la construccin, sus ingresos provienen como operario en una maquiladora en esta ciudad. Estar muy agradecido por el apoyo recibido por ustedes y sobre todo porque su hijo va a tener un lugar reservado en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jesus Antonio C. lives with his son and wife. He already has a small house but there's only one bedroom. He's building a room on the house but he doesn't have enough money to pay labor costs. He's bought materials little by little so that's no problem.

He's applying for a loan to begin construction. He has an income from a factory job in the city. He will be very grateful for your help, above all because his son will have his own space in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Addition.

loan.name: Lidia's Group

texts.es: La asociacin Nueva Vida pertenece al centro focal Panamericana, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace ms siete aos. Casadas en su mayora tienen un promedio de cinco hijos cada una, en algunos casos sus parejas las abandonaron teniendo que hacerse cargo ellas solas de sus familias, es por ello que se vieron en la necesidad de buscar actividades propias que les permita generar recursos para el bien de sus familias. La asociacin Nueva Vida tiene diversas actividades, Soledad por ejemplo se dedica a la filmacin de eventos sociales, Ross tiene una tienda de lubricantes, otras de ellas realizan variedad de masitas (pastelitos y galletas) en horno industrial, y otras se dedican al tejido de mantas en macrame.
